title: White House Cable to Lodge On Pressure for Saigon Reforms
description: Cablegram from White House to Ambassador Lodge, Sept. 17, 1963. The Pentagon study says this message followed a meeting of the National Security Council but adds, There is no evidence on the degree of consensus of the principals in this decision.

title: 'Chocolate Factory'
description: The children have so few good films to claim as their own. Much as it pains us to say so, "Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory" is not one of them. Yes, it's clean. It's also tedious and stagy with little sparkle and precious little humor.The picture, which opened around town yesterday, cries out for animation, not live actors. Bright colorations and a mercurial animated flow could have done wonders to Roald Dahl's story of a little boy allowed to tour a magic chocolate factory, with his character tested by a nimble chocolate impresario.Most of the picture looks exactly like what it is, a fairly elaborate project shot by an American company inside a Bavarian studio. The three leads, Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson and young Peter Ostrom, are quite appealing, unlike a pedestrian Leslie Bricusse-Anthony Newley score.Take the youngsters only if they're tired of "Sesame Street," and why should they be?

title: Teleprompter in Accord With Wrather for Muzak
description: The Teleprompter Corpora tion announced yesterday that it has signed an agreement to acquire Muzak, Inc., from the Wrather Corporation for stock approximating $25million. The agreement is subject to approv al of Wrather stockholders at a special meeting and at the annual meeting of Teleprompter, both to be held in late Au gust or early September.

title: F.T.C. Complaint Set On WarnerLambert Link
description: The Federal Trade Commis sion is issuing a formal com plaint against the merger of WarnerLambert Company and the ParkeDavis Company, thus terminating the negotia tions to settle the proposed complaint. Stuart K. Hensley, chairman of WarnerLambert, said that, while the company and its counsel had never agreed with the F.T.C.'s pro posed complaint, the company had made a maximum effort to resolve the specific areas of the complaint in order to avoid the burden of extensive litiga tion for both the company and the Government.

title: Report Clears California Legal Aid Project, Praises It and Assails Its Critics
description: WASHINGTON, June 30The Office of Economic Opportunity released today a report that completely absolved the con troversial California Rural Legal Assistance project of wrongdo ing and criticized the adminis tration of Gov. Ronald Reagan for making the accusation.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: With volume rising again prices continued to advance yesterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Bank Tie to Be Restudied
description: WASHINGTON, June 30 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board announced today it would reconsider its denial of the application of the Connec ticut Bank and Trust Company, Hartford, to merge with the North Side Bank and Trust Company, Bristol, Conn. The board stated that the merger application would be recon sidered on the basis of relevant facts concerning the market in which the banks operate.

title: MISS HOFMANN WINS TWO JUMPER EVENTS
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa., June 30 Carol Hofman scored a dou ble today when she piloted Mr. and Mrs. Miles Valentine's pushover to victory in the open jumper class and her own mount, Out Late, to the blue ribbon in the intermediate jumper test at the opening ses sion of the fiveday Gaudeamus Farms horse show.

title: Author's Trial to Begin
description: HUMBOLDT, Tenn., June 30 An allmale jury of 11 whites and one Negro, plus a white alternate, was chosen today for the murder trial of Jesse Hill Ford, white author of a bestselling book concerning a double standard of justice for whites and blacks in the South. The selections required two full days and the questioning of 98 potential jurors. Tomorrow the state of Tennessee will present its case that the 42yearold author committed firstdegree murder in the rifle slaying last Nov. 16 of George Henry Doaks Jr., a Negro soldier.

title: Davis Hearing Halted Again
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., June 30 (UPI)With Angela Davis pro claiming solidarity with Ru chell Magee, her codefendant, against what he described as a racist society,. Magee brought pretrial hearings in their murderkidnap case to a halt again yesterday. Judge Richard. E. Amason granted a motion by Miss Davis's at torneys to adjourn until next Tuesday after Magee told the attorneys he would consider them part of what he called the pig conspiracy if they did not suspend their argu ments.

title: A HISTORY OFFICE PLANNED BY STATE
description: ALBANY, June 30Gover nor Rockefeller has signed bill establishing an Office of State History and State Ar chives to house historical rec ords, it was announced today.

title: Proposals on Power Demand Made at New England Hearing

They acted as the temperature soared to 94 degrees and voltages were reduced by 5 per cent through out the New England states.

title: Short Blackout in Montreal

A spokesman for HydroQuebec, the power authority, said the blackout had been caused by failure of a power line from the Manicouagan Dam in northeast ern Quebec.

title: Writer Weds Mrs. Mason

title: Shock for Washington
description: Six days later the dam broke. South Vietnamese Special Forces troops in white helmets carried out midnight raids against Buddhist pagodas throughout the country. More than 1,400 people, mostly monks, were arrested and many of them beaten. Two days later, the army generals conspiring against President Diem first sought official American sup port.

title: Sweden's 'Language of Love'
description: Having been cleared officially, "Language of Love," the Swedish-made color documentation of sex that was seized as obscene by Customs in October, 1969, turns out, unfortunately, to be somewhat of an anticlimax. Timing obviously is the villain here, for despite its quartet of sincere and frank experts and a variety of comely, unbilled volunteers, who expertly demonstrate the experts' observations, "Language of Love" adds nothing specially new to our movie scene, which, at this late date, already has been filled with practically every aspect of sex, educational, blue and in between.If this import is not particularly a pace-setter, it does leave the impression of trying to inform without leering. And, Dr. Sture Cullhed, a Swedish gynecologist; Dr. Maj-Brigt Bergstrom-Walan, a Swedish psychologist-educator, and Inge and Sten Hegeler, Danish psychologists-authors, who admittedly were inspired by Kinsey and Masters and Johnson, are sedately adult and direct in their approach to sexual anxieties and misconceptions, petting, masturbation, contraceptives, the organs and proper and improper practices.While the method of enlisting is not divulged, their obviously willing volunteers cooperate (via hidden cameras) with equal frankness and seeming sincerity. The uninitiate might be shocked by the varied, explicit nude sequences but an undisturbed adult viewer respecting the panel's intentions is still left wondering if the producers aren't interested in money more than they are in education."The Language of Love," which arrived at the Carnegie Hall Cinema, the Agee Cine and the Kips Bay yesterday, is the English-language version that is reported to be shorter than the original, Swedish-language edition. Educationally, it's the same the world over.

description: WASHINGTON, June 30  H & R Block, Inc., which says it prepares income tax returns for eight million American annual ly, was accused by the Federal Trade Commission today of false advertising and illegally using confidential information supplied by customers.

description: AACHEN, West Germany, (AP)  Hartwig Steenken of West Germany narrowly de feated Harvey Smith of Britain today to become Eqopean horsejumping champion at the Aachen international equestrian tournament. Steenken, on Si mona, received 11.5 points to Smith's 13.5 aboard Evan Jones.

title: Questions for Kennedy
description: The Pentagon study shows President Kennedy facing three main questions on Vietnam during his term of office'whether to make an irrevocable com mitment to prevent a Communist vic tory; whether to commit ground combat units to achieve his ends; whether to give top priority to the military battle against the Vietcong or to the political reforms necessary for winning popular support.

title: Books of The Times
description: DISCRETIONS. By Mary de Rachewiltz. 307 pages. Illustrated. AtlanticLittle, Brown. $8.95.

title: Film: 'What's the Matter With Helen?':Debbie Reynolds Stars With Shelley Winters Horror Movie Makes Fun of the 1930's
description: "What's the Matter With Helen?" belongs to that singular genre of screen horror literature that is almost as formal and unvarying in theme as that of Eric Rohmer's Six Moral Tales: Two women, beyond or just at middle age, abandoned by the men in their lives, find themselves isolated from the normally neurotic world and locked into a relationship of psychotic dependency.Helen (Shelley Winters) and Adelle (Debbie Reynolds) attain a certain notoriety in F.D.R.'s America when their two sons are convicted of an especially unwholesome murder (in the world of horror films, some murders must be less wholesome than others). Seeking anonymity, they move from the Middle West to Hollywood, where they set up a dance studio to train the sweet daughters of hideous mothers to tap-tap-tap their ways into careers as fourth-string Shirley Temples.The film, which opened yesterday at the Victoria and 86th Street East Theaters, spends quite as much time making sappy fun of the 1930's period  through things like Ovaltine ads and the self-conscious use of period slangas it does on its not terribly mysterious plot. The thing that's the matter with Helen is that she's a religious nut and definitely loony, which is obvious so early in the movie that "What's the Matter With Helen?" never has much place to go.Curtis Harrington ("Night Tide," "Games") tends to be a fancy director, but here, aside from some superfluous flashbacks that take the form of gruesome fantasies, he doesn't impose himself between his plot and his public. Miss Reynolds, looking like an ageless kewpie doll with platinum hair, and Miss Winters, wearing the expression of a reproachful pudding most of the time, apparently had a good deal of undisciplined fun making the film.If they seem to be following in the footsteps of Bette and Joan and Olivia and Geraldine and Ruth, it's because their screenplay was written by Henry Farrell, who also wrote "Baby Jane" and "Sweet Charlotte," which inspired, in turn, "Aunt Alice." This new movie is so perfunctory, it's likely to give misogyny a bad name.

title: Girl, 8, Shot by Cabby Sprayed by Open Hydrant
description: An 8yearold girl was hit by a bullet fired last night by a taxi driver after his car was sprayed by youths playing with an open fire hydrant, according to the police.

title: $30MILLION LOSS AT COLLINS RADIO
description: The Collins Radio Company, reported yesterday that its net losses for the 10 months ended May 28 would amount to $30, 333,000 after provision for pos sible losses on certain pro grams.

description: The annual Vernon Rice Memorial awards, given for outstanding achievement in Off Broadway theater, have gone to the production of Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prizewinning play, Long Day's Journey, Into Night.

title: Earl Neal, Who Represented Jersey Standard Oil, Dead

title: Death Knell for Diem

That night, the C.I.A. man learned that the conspiracy was on the tracks again and that General Minh, its leader, wanted to discuss the details. Ambas sador Lodge approved the meeting.

Apartments become subject to almost com plete control of landlords while protection of tenants severely curtailed.
