description: ALL nations push their own products. And up to a point I see noth ing wrong in that, for, if charity does not begin at home, how is a composer to get his start in life? The trou ble starts when critics start invoking double standards, casting an indulgent eye on homegrown geese, but pre serving a rigorous measure for alien swans. There is enough of that on both sides of the Atlantic to awaken a healthy scepticism in New Yorkers when a London crit ic salutes a British opera as a masterpiece.

title: Robert Kramek Marries Aileen MacLaren
description: SHREWSBURY, N. J., July 10Miss Aileen MacLaren, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald D. MacLaren of Plain field, was married here this morning to Robert Gustav Kramek, son of Maj. Stanley E. Kramek, U. S. M. C., re tired, and Mrs. Kramek of Boonton. The Rev. Dr. Robert L. Swaim, chaplain of Beaver College, a Presbyterian minis ter, who heads the religion and philosophy departments at Beaver, performed the ceremony at the Shadow brook here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Sergeant Johnson couldn't have bought a can of soup with his Medal of Honor at that grocery store. Perhaps that's one reason why he went in with gun in hand.

title: Chemical Smog Plagues Houston
description: HOUSTON, July 10Chemi cally laden smog has felled more than 150 persons since late April along the Houston ship channel, said to be one of the world's most polluted streams.

title: Cowboys' Tody Smith Balks at AllStar Game
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., July 10 (AP)Tody Smith, a tackle who was the first draft choice of the Dallas Cowboys, won't play in the College AllStar game against Baltimore July 30 without a Cowboy contract, his attor ney said today.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Linda Casucci Sets Wedding on Aug. 28
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., July 10Capt. Americo Joseph Casucci, U.S.N., and Mrs. Casucci have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Jean Casucci, to Jeffrey Alan Neu bauer, son, of Joseph Alan Neubauer, president of PPG Industries, Inc., and Mrs. Neubauer of Pittsburgh.

title: The World
description: SAIGONThe public stance of American policymakers toward the presidential elections here next fall seems simple enough: The United States will adopt a handsoff attitude in an effort to show neutrality. Instructions have gone out to American military men and civilians not to offer or give any support to any candidate by word or deed.

title: Pursuing a Bogus Manhood
description: GROWING up has al ways been a hard thing in America, a nation which, born of a European supercivilization and a native wilderness, has itself often seemed entoiled in a kind of eternal adolescence. Lately, for many, it has come to seem almost impossible. Some of our wittier, more frantic young revolution aries have even taken to declaring it undesirable. Still others  the homicidal auto matons of My Lai or Beverly Hills, the suicidal drug ad dicts proliferating in our midstsimply give mute evi dence of some extremes to which the current epidemic of dissociation among the young has taken us. According to what models, and at what cost, does one become a re sponsible man or woman an adultin the frustrat ed, disenchanted America of today.?

title: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title
Petty Gains the Pole
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., July 10 (AP) Richard Petty of Randleman, N. C., wheeled his 1971 Plym outh around the Bristol Inter national Speedway track at 104.589 miles an hour yester day and won the pole position for tomorrow's Volunteer 500 NASCAR Grand National stock car race.

title: The World
description: Concern was etched on the brow of the Japanese chemical executive. He was on his way back to Tokyo from a meeting in Washington, where Japanese and American businessmen had spent four days discussing Ja pan's deteriorating economic re lations with the United States.

title: 2 Youths Sought in Blast
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., July 10 (UPI)The police today sought two youths who were seen in the area of City Hall shortly be fore a bomb blew out all the windows along one side of the building. Mayor Joseph H. Door ley Jr. said the bombing last night was definitely the work of anarchists who are out to destroy the fabric of this gov eminent.

title: The English at table and in bed
description: Tell me what you eat said BrillatSavarin and I will tell you what you are, and Philippa Pullar with this maxim as her text, has presented a picture of the English people in terms of the changes in diet that the caprice of history has forced upon them and the effects that those changes have had upon their way of life, in particular upon their amatory activities. There are two appendices; the one a 21page list of recipes, the other a sixpage essay on aphro disiacs. It is a highly entertaining book.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Negroes And the Jews
description: A survey of blackJewish re lations from the antebellum South to the present. With a journalistic approach and some historical interpretation, the author touches on the social and political forces that have formed and rent alliances and, more recently, stimulated con flicts between the two minori ties. Interesting sections on the New York teachers' strike and Hoving's Harlem on My Mind. A good introduction to the sub ject.

title: M'CARTER SELECTS U.C.L.A. FROM 250
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 10 (AP) Andre McCarter of Philadel phia's Overbrook High School, called by one college scout the best guard to come out of high school since Oscar Rob ertson, has decided to enroll at the University of California Los Angeles. He had more than 250 college offers.

title: MRS. COURT BEATS MISS GOOLAGONG
description: DUBLIN, July 10Mrs. Mar garet Court of Australia took a measure of revenge for her Wimbledon defeat by downing 19yearold Evonne Goolagong today, 63, 26, 63, for the Irish open tennis championship.

title: SLEEPER ROUTES LISTED BY AMTRAK
description: Amtrak's new nationwide schedule of rail passenger serv ice, effective tomorrow, shows 18 longhaul sleeping car routes and easy connections at Chi cago between New York and West Coast trains.

title: Angler Reels In Stamp And He Boats a Muskie
description: ROANOKE, Va., July 10 (AP)  Fred Dillon and Jack White didn't have any luck casting for bass at Smith Mountain Lake today, so they headed their boat back to ward their campsite and trolled along the way.

title: Aussie Girl, 14 Scores Again in Swim
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., July 10(UPI) Shane Gould, a 14 yearold Australian, posted the world's second fastest time in the 200meter freestyle, today at the Santa Clara international swimming meet.

title: British Golf Fans Adopt Mr. Lu From Taiwan, Invite. Him Back
description: SOUTHPORT, England, July 10 (AP)Mr. Lu from Taiwan got an open invitation from Britain's Royal and Ancient Golf Club to come back to this country as often as you like and we hope you'll bring more fine golfers from the Far East.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON  Why should the United States make more loan funds available to impoverished foreign na tions when not enough loan funds are available to impoverished areas in this country?

title: Et Al.
description: The life of a poor black wo man told in novelistic style. The account is honest and conse quently illuminates some of the pathos and the joy of black life in America. Ossie is born in Ohio, lives for a time in the South, is shunted from aunt to aunt as her husbandless mother seeks work, gets preg nant herself, marries, is desert ed, begins a similar cycle ex cept that she does not leave her children. She becomes in volved in the bureaucratic wel fare wringer, but manages to maintain a semblance of digni ty. True to life but uninspired.

title: WINDWARD PASSAGE KEEPS SAILING LEAD
description: SAN PEDRO, Calif., July 10 (UPI)Mark Johnson's Wind ward Passage, a 73foot ketch, moved to within 874 miles of Diamond Head and increased its lead to 61 miles in the Los An gelestoHawaii TransPacific yacht race today.

title: 5,000 Americans in Morocco
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) There are approximately 5,000 Americans in Morocco 123 United States Government officials with 208 dependents; 1,892 military personnel with 1,664 dependents, 127 Peace Corps members and 864 private citizens.

title: Soviet Ambassador Sees Prime Minister of Malta
description: VALETTA, Malta, July 10 (UPI)The Soviet Ambassador to Britain, Mikhail N. Smirnov sky, met today with Prime Min ister Dom Mintoff, who has de manded revision of defense agreements with Britain and barred United States Navy ships from the island since tak ing office last month.

title: Leschly Gains Final
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 10 (UPI)It will be Ilie Nastase of Rumania and Jan Leschly of Denmark in the final of the $33,000 Swedish open tennis championship.

title: OREGON LEADERS SUPPORT JACKSON
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 10 To understand why many Ore gon Democrats respect the po litical clout of Senator Henry M. JaCkson of Washington, it is helpful to go back to a re ception three weeks ago at the Benson Hotel.

title: World Bank Circulates Pakistan Study
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The World Bank announced today that it survey by its special mission, which reportedly ad vised against new international economic aid to Pakistan, was being distributed to the bank's 21 executive directors and al ternates.

title: Denham Gets Dual Post
description: James Denham of Chester, N. Y., a graduate of the Uni versity of New Hampshire, has been named head baseball and wrestling coach at New England College. Denham, 23, will also be an assistant to the head football coach, Ron Rosen bleeth.

title: Omaha Is on the Alert After 4 Nights of Unrest
description: OMAHA, July 10City offi cials and the police remained on the alert today after four nights of confrontations be tween youths and the authori ties at War Memorial Park.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: A's Win in 20th, 10, From Angels on a Single by Mangual
description: OAKLAND, July 10 (AP)  Angel Mangual singled home the winning run with two out in the 20th inning, carrying the Oakland A's to a 1.0 victory over the California Angels and the curfew early this morning.

title: Music
description: FOR some time, John Nelson has been want ing to do something off the beaten path with his Pro Arte Festival Chorus and Orchestra. He has been interested in breaking away from the Baroque litera ture  Handel and Bach which makes up the bulk of the ensemble's repertory and in doing an opera in con cert form. Organizations that want to perform operas in the concert hall are often deg terred by the expense of hav ing a chorus. With one in hand, Nelson's problem in this respect is already solved.

title: Attack in Morocco Fits an Arab Pattern
description: CAIRO, July 10The army revolt in Morocco tonight ap pears to fit into a pattern of radicalization in the Arab world that has gained momen tum since the defeat of Arab armies by Israel in 1967.

title: The Nation
description: The interest ratethe price one pays to borrow money usually is slow to rise in a period of economic recovery; the banks have ample funds to meet rising demands. But in the present recovery, interest rates have not followed the scriptthey have been moving up rapidly. And some experts believe they may pose a threat to the recovery..

title: Heating Oil Cost Rise Seen
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) American homeowners who heat with oil will pay 4 cents'more per gallon for it this year because of the oil import quota program, Senator Wil liam Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today. Mr. Proxmire, in a statement; said oil users on the East Coast would pay increased total costs of some $559million.

title: Foreign Affairs and foreign affairs
description: In 1922, when the Council on For eign Relations decided to establish a quarterly journal, it offered the edi torship to Archibald Cary Coolidge, a professor of history at Harvard, who in 1919 had been one of Woodrow Wilson's advisers at the Peace Conference. Coolidge agreed to accept, provided that, as the jour nal's responsible head, he would be entitled to work in the atmos phere most favorable to his own in tellectual processes (which meant in the Widener Library in Cam bridge) and that he would be given an assistant, who would do almost all the regular work as editor in New York. A man of about 30 would be best, he suggested, old enough to have already some knowledge of the world as well as intelligence, and to be able to meet important people on a reasonable footing of equal ity... His first choice was Hamil ton Fish Armstrong, at that time an editorial writer for the New York Post.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: A vital element of govern ment assurance as to the future economic wellbeing of the United States depends upon the prompt Congres sional enactment of legisla tion to deal with selected corporate liquidity crises by establishing an R.F.C. (Re construction Finance Corpo ration) type of authority to cover loan guarantees for such corporations. This leg islation would permit the Federal Government to guar antee loans essential for the continuance of operations vi tal to the national interest or to such interest within a given region.

title: GOOD GRIEF VICTOR IN LIGHTNING RACE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 10 Macy Nelson of Black Rock Yacht Club, Bridgeport, sailing Good Grief, won the opening race of the Connecticut area Lightning Class Governor's Cup regatta in a dying southerly wind on Long Island Sound off Riverside Yacht Club today.

title: ShaftAt Last, a food Saturday Night Movie
description: HOW long has it been since you've seen a good Saturday night movie? I'm not talking about how long it's been since you've seen a good movie on a Saturday night, which is something else entirely. Seeing a good movie on any night is a rare phenomenon, but possibly not quite as rare as coming across a good Saturday night movie, which, as I'm sure anybody over 35 will remember, is a movie with out great pretensions, which is enter taining in a simple (though not neces sarily simpleminded) way, and which manages in some mysterious manner to evoke similar reactions of laughter, tears, shock, surprise, fright, goodwill and anger in all sorts of dissimilar audi ences.

title: DavidoffEisenberg Team Wins U.S. Handball Title
description: The fifthseeded team of Kenny Davidoff and Howie Ei senberg of Union Temple won the National Amateur Athletic Union's onewall doubles hand ball championship by scoring a 2110, 2116 upset victory over secondseeded Steve Sandler and Don Weber of the 92d Street YMHA before a capacity crowd of 1,500 at the Brighton Beach Baths in Brooklyn yester day.

title: Pennsylvania Group Pushes LindsayforPresident Draft
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 10 (UPI)A group whose aim is the support of a draft of Mayor Lindsay of New York as a Pres idential candidate in 1972 has opened headquarters here.

title: Baroque Bill for Caramoor
description: Julius Rudel will conduct a concert of Baroque music at the Caramoor Festival, Kato nah, N. Y., next Saturday. The program will include a Suite in G minor by Lully, Bach's Bran denburg Concerto No. 2, Vi valdi's Concerto for Two Trum pets and Handel's Concerto for Oboe. The event was omitted from the listing in Who Makes Music and Where in Section 2 of today's New York Times.

title: 3 BLACK POLICEMEN RELEASED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, July 10 (AP)The executive director of the Afro American Patrolman's League was released today from po lice custody on departmental charges of insubordination, dis respect for a superior officer and violation of an order.

title: Pool Opens in BedfordStuyvesant
description: The BedfordStuyvesant com munity was guest of honor yesterday at the opening of the Park Department's largest out door swimming pool complex in Brooklyn, at Marcy and De Kalb Avenues.

title: Top U. S. Aide in Highlands Optimistic on Pacificaion
description: NHATRANG, South Vietnam, July 8John Paul Vann, a re tired Army officer who has often been critical of the con duct of the Vietnam war, is now optimistically taking on what may prove to be his most difficult task in eight years hereeliminating most of the American presence in the least pacified military region of Viet nam, the vast Central High lands.

title: Letters
description: As a black New York City policeman I am deeply in volved in the issues discussed in A Policeman Complains (by Robert Coles, June 13). Some of the statements made by the sergeant quotea in the article I consider of fending to black people. How ever, I speak here as an in dividual and do not represent any group or organization.

title: A Retiring Fire Aide Here Succeeded by Rand Official
description: One of the city's three dep uty fire commissioners retired yesterday and an official of the New York City Rand Institute, a private think tank that does consultant work for the city, was named to succeed him.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: FLORIDIAN, 16, LEADS MASTERS WATER SKI
description: PINE MOUNTAIN, Ga., July 10 (UN)  Sixteenyearold Wayne Grimditch of Hillsboro Beach, Fla., held a 16point lead over the defending cham pion Ricky McCormick of In dependence, Mo., today at the twothirds mark of the 13th an nual Masters water ski tourna ment.

title: Meanwhile, the Master Was Seducing His Wife
description: HAS a woman ever received a more mar velous Christmas pres ent than Richard Wagner gave his wife, Co sima, on Dec. 25, 1870? As she descended the stairs of their villa, Triebchen, now as then overlooking the Lake of Lucerne and the Alps of cen tral Switzerland, a chamber orchestra, already assembled in the hall, began to play a work that Wagner had writ ten specially for her. This was the origin of Siegfried Idyll, as it has come to be known, or to give it its full title, The Triebchen Idyll, with Fidi's (Siegfried's) Bird and Orange Sunrise.

title: Family Denied Aid Here Returns To California and Is Given Check
description: LOS ANGELES, July 10 (AP) A California welfare family, denied aid in New York City under strict new laws and given bus fare home, arrived yesterday and received a wel fare check almost immediately.

title: Hassan's Decade on the Throne Marked by Crises
description: When he became King of Mo rocco on Feb. 26, 1961, at the age of 31, Hassan II was widely experienced in his country's in tricate politics.

title: Kickbacks Still Thrive in Indiana
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., July When Bud Watson went looking for a job this spring, he called the local office of the Indiana State Highway Depart ment and asked if anything was available and what the qualifications might be.

title: I'm Glad You Didn't Take It Personally
description: Except for some behindthe scenes information and anec dotes about the television world, this is just a continua tion of Bouton's frank ap praisal of baseball in Ball Four. As such, it resembles a 15th inningeveryone exhaust ed, no end in sight. Bouton is occasionally funny; but as he points out, apropos knuckleballs and flutter pitches, trying too hard is trouble.

title: Europe's First Feminist Has Changed the Second Sex
description: THE music at a wedding pro cession always reminds me of the music which leads soldiers into battle, Heinrich Heine once remarked, at a time when matri mony seemed a less crippling en tanglement than it does today. Per haps this explains his later readiness to throw caution to the winds and to marry Eugenie Mirat, a Paris grisette with whom he had been living for some years in unheroic sin.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Peter Weed Weds Cheryl Clark
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 10  Miss Cheryl Chalmers Clark, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Holbrook Clark, was married here this after noon to Peter Redfield Weed, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred erick R. Weed of Antigua, Guatemala.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: With the establishment of the In stitute of Medicine of the National Academy of Sciences, one is to hope that the divergent forces in medicine, with an able assist from the social sciences, will at long last be gathered into a single meaningful organizational structure.

title: WouldBe Suicide at Bridge Dissuaded by 3 Policemen
description: Three policemen talked a wouldbe suicide out of jump ing from the Queens tower of the Throggs Neck Bridge, 500 feet into the water below yes terday afternoon.

title: More Tennis Turmoil
description: Tennis is at war again.

title: The Black Sheep And Other Tales
description: Once there was a Cockroach named Gregory Samsa who dreamed that he was a Cock roach named Franz Kafka who dreamed that he was a writer who wrote about a clerk named Gregory Samsa who dreamed that he was a Cockroach. This is one of 40 or so fables by the Guatemalan writer August Montresso. Not so funny as Thurber, ingenious as Borges, witty as La Font ??ine, but not without charm either.

title: Kosygin at Mongolian Fete
description: MOSCOW, July 10 (AP) Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union gave China notice today that Moscow would firmly resist any efforts to weaken Mongolia's ties with the Soviet bloc. Speaking at the Mongolian capital of Ulan Bator on the 50th anniversary of the Communist revolution in Mon golia, Mr. Kosygin declared that Mongolia and the Soviet Union had been marching to gether for 50 years, the Tass news agency reported.

title: 2 ExP.S.A.L. Stars to Play at Monticello Tuesday
description: Two former Public Schools Athletic League standouts, Jackie Jackson and Pablo Robertson, will be with the Harlem Globetrotters when they face the New Jersey Reds Tuesday evening at Kutsher's Country Club, Mon ticello, N. Y. The game will be played far the benefit of the United States Olympic basketball team.

title: U.S. POLICY FILES REVEALED SLOWLY
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The Government is keeping 49,000 cubic feet of documents on World War II stored in the Na tional Archives Building, a col onnaded neoclassical structure on Pennsyvlania Avenue a few blocks from the White House.

title: WASHINGTON TENNIS DRAWS TOP PLAYERS
description: Some of the world's top ten nis players will compete for $50,000 in prizes in the third Washington Star international tennis championships in Wash ington, D. C. starting tomorrow.

title: Mrs. Lazarus Has Son
description: A son was born June 13 to Mr. and Mrs. Steven Lazarus of Toorak, Australia at St. Vincent's Maternity Hospital in East Melbourne. Mrs. Laza rus is the former Miss Elissa Camen of Brooklyn.

title: Editorial Cartoon 4  No Title
CAIRO SAID TO BAR A SUEZ PROPOSAL
description: CAIRO, July 10  A Cairo newspaper reported today that the Egyptian leadership had re jected a proposal under which Israeli troops would withdraw about 15 miles from the eastern shore of the Suez Canal to en able a reopening of the water way.

title: Trevino Wins British Open by Stroke
description: Lee Trevino won the Brit ish Open golf championship yesterday, shooting a 70 for a fourround total of 278 and a onestroke edge over Lu Liang Huan of Taiwan. Tre vino's victory earned $13,200.

title: Horan Is Appointed Aide of Harvard Football Team
description: Harvard has completed its staff of fulltime football assist ants by hiring Robert E. (Bob) Horan, a former Colgate aide.

title: Toni R. Alexander Is Betrothed
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 10 Miss Toni Roy Alexander, whose grandfather, Arthur Alexander, founded the Alex ander Handbag Manufactur ing Company of New York, plans to be married Aug. 29 to Bruce L. Lev, counsel to the City of Norwalk. The ceremony will be at the home of the parents of the bride tobe, Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Alexander, who have an nounced the engagement. The future bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert P. Lev of New Haven.

title: Walker, in Lotus, Captures Formula 3 Race in England
description: DARLINGTON, England, July 10 (AP)Dave Walker of Brit ain, driving a team Lotus, won the Rothman's International Trophy Formula 3 auto race at the Croft autodrome today.

title: Manic 5
description: The building of the Manicou ganOutardes Rivers hydroelec tric project (renamed the Daniel Johnson Dam in honor of Que bec's late Prime Minister)the world's largest multiple arch dam. The narrative covers the earliest surveys and ground breaking, the subsequent engi neering problems and life among the construction work ers. If you want to know how to build a dam, this is for you.

title: Council of Europe Votes Ode to Joy Continent's Anthem
description: BERLIN, July 10Represen tatives of the 17 countries in the Council of Europe voted unanimously here this week to make the Ode to Joy music from Beethoven's Ninth Sym phony the future anthem of Western Europe.

title: FLEISCHER LEADS BOSTON SYMPHONY
description: LENOX, Mass., July 10It is not usual, to say the least, for a conductor whose career is just one year old to find himself facing the Boston Symphony Orchestra. But Leon Fleischer is not the usual conductor. He took up the Batonist's way of life as a result of a mysterious ailment that causes chronic cramping in his right hand.

title: Youth Drowns at Aquacade
description: The body of a 19yearold youth, tentatively identified from a draft card found in a pocket as Clifton L. Hood of 18627 Baisley Boulevard, St. Albans, Queens, was discovered yesterday morning at the bot tom of a 16foot deep pool of the Aquacade in Flushing Mead ow Park. The body was found by a Parks Department employe after he had found the youth's clothing near a fence, which the youth apparently had scaled to enter the Aquacade's grounds.

title: Brell, 66 Rookie for Bucks, Hurts Ankle in Pickup Game
description: MILWAUKEE, July 10 (AP) The top rookie scheduled to report to the Milwaukee Bucks' camp on Thursday probably won't be able to make it, team officials said today.

title: My Hands Are Burning
description: August 1914, Aleksandr Sol zhenitsyn's latest novel, which has been banned in Russia, was published last month in Paris by a small emigre Russian house, the YMCA Press. Solzhenitsyn himself had made the bold deci sion to establish the book's copy right in France. In an epilogue to the book, the author wrote that he had been unable to stoop to the indignity of observing the Soviet censors' dictate that the G in God be written in lower case, while K.G.B. (the initials of the State Security Committee, the secret police) must be capi talized.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: RACE WEEK OPENS WITH NO BREEZES
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 10 The 73d annual race week at Larchmont Yacht Club began breathlessly todayno air and therefore no races for the One Design classes.

title: Chilean Economy Not Significantly Hurt by Earthquake's Damage
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 10 The earthquake that killed 82 people Thursday night has caused serious property damage in the central region, but has not significantly hurt the Chilean economy.

title: Cubs Beat Padres, 31
description: SAN DIEGO, July 10 (UPI) Joe Pepitone hat his 12th home run with a man aboard in the sixth inning to snap a 11 tie and Ferguson Jenkins pitched a fourhitter for his 13th victory as the Chicago Cubs beat the San Diego Padres, 31, today.

title: The Going Is Not So Great
description: In what is the worst year on recordto this pointfor airline financial results, The New York Times last week asked. Najeeb E. Halaby, chairman and president of Pan American World Air ways, 13 questions about his company and the industry's troubles. The questions and answers follow:

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Britain on the Edge
description: Should the United States merge po litically and economically with Brazil, Central America, Mexico and Canada?

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Art
description: LONDON.

title: Lawyers and Economics
description: ROCHESTER  The ambi ance in Room 166 Dewey Hall at the University of Rochester is hardly typical of summerschool relaxation. True, the attire of the pro fessors and the early middle aged male students is con servatively casual classic sports shirts, shorts and odd slacks and occasionally a hairy leg and dirty sneakers propped on a desk.

title: NearCollision Reminds Airlines That Peril Persists
description: We missed them by about 50 feet, said Capt. Robert L. Horton, pilot of a Trans World Airlines Boeing 707, after he abruptly nosed down his 550 mileanhour craft and man aged to fly just below an American Airlines plane cross ing from the right.

title: Julia R. Wight Becomes Bride Of a Physician
description: BEAR LAKE, Pa., July 10 Miss Julia Robinson Wight of Boston was married here this afternoon to Dr. Henry E. Schniewind Jr., who recently completed a tour of duty as a staff psychiatrist at the Na val Hospital in Newport, R. I.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: RushHour Lanes for Buses Are Tested on Expressway in Boston
description: BOSTON, July 10  The transportation companies are satisfied and the bus drivers are delighted, but the State of Massachusetts, which is paying the bill, is not sure it is getting its money's worth.

title: Nashojet Scores by Head
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., July 10 (AP)Nashojet scored by head over the favored Capital Host in the featured eighth race at Finger Lakes race track to day. Renest was third.

title: Stamps
description: DESIGNS for an 8cent stamped en velope in honor of bowling, and an 8cent adhesive postage stamp for the 450th anniversary of San Juan, Puerto Rico, have been released by Postmaster General Winton M. Blount.

title: FEUDAL WAYS STIR ETHIOPIAN DEBATE
description: ADDIS ABABA, EthiopiaA bill that would protect tenant farmers has focused attention on the issue of land ownership and helps to illuminate the peculiarand almost mysteri ousnature of a still semifeu dal society under internal stress.

title: Mrs. Court in Merion Tennis
description: Mrs. Margaret Smith Court of Australia, the women's de fender, has entered the Penn sylvania lawn tennis champion ships at Merlon Cricket Club Aug. 16 through 23.

title: Samuel Bronfman Dead at 80; Founded Distillers Corporation
description: MONTREAL, July 11Sam uel Bronfman, founder and president of. Distillers Corpora tionSeagrains Ltd., of.Montreal and New York, died tonight at his home in Westmount, Mon treal. Helwas 80 years old.

title: Latin Suspect Held On $1Million Bail In Heroin Seizure
description: A suspect in the attempted smuggling of 175 pounds of heroin seized at Kennedy Inter national Airport Thursday was held last night in $1million bail.

title: AN ACT IN DEPTH BY JULIE WILSON
description: Elegance is something that does not turn up very often in nightclubs these days  and when it does, it is apt to be offered with a suggestion of campiness. Julie Wilson, who has moved into the Rainbow Grill for the month of July, may be one of the last of the elegants, she with her chiseled features and her dark brown hair pulled severely back into an enormous bun. She is straightforward, honest, very relaxed performer who does not have to work at being ele gant. She just happens to be that way.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: A few Sundays ago I went on a TV binge, watching the tube from noon till midnight and concentrating on public affairs programs. I recom mend this exercise to every one who is concerned with the great pressures being exerted on business today by the Government and con sumer groups.

title: Harvard and Dietz Qualify at Lucerne
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, July 10Harvard University's light weight eightoared crew and Jim Dietz, the sculler from the Bronx, performed brilliantly to day at the opening of the twoday Lucerne international regatta.

title: H.U.D. Names Fiscal Agents
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) The Department of Housing and Urban Development an nounced yesterday that the Aetna Casualty and Surety Company, the American Uni versal Insurance Company and the Insurance Company of North America would act as fiscal agents for Federal crime insurance. The department said earlier this week that it would see insurance in states where private crime coverage was not available at reasonable rates.

title: Ukrainian Dancers Learn Their Heritage Early
description: Groups of youngsters have been gathering every week in Queens to learn some of the new dancesHunyavita, Kol vake, Hutzel, Zaproshika, Kolornaka.

title: SUFFOLK FEATURE TO FAST ROYALTY
description: BOSTON, July 10 (AP) Sterling Orr's Fast Royalty won the $16,420 Mayflower Stakes today at Suffolk Downs before a crowd of 13,583.

title: Medicine
description: WASHINGTONThe field of human cancer research is haunt ed by viruses. Like tiny malig nant ghosts they appear and then vanish; leave their foot prints, but defy pursuit.

title: CEAUSESCU AIDE ASSAILS HUNGARY
description: VIENNA, July 10A dispute has flared between Rumania and Hungary over the recent Peking visit of Nicolae Ceausescu, the Rumanian leader.

title: the traveler's world
description: WE have just witnessed another of those inexplicable gyrations that result when the Civil Aeronautics Board and the conservative wing of the International Air Transport Association, the airlines' cartel, collide with attempts to inject price competition into international air travel, and it was a battle of much less than titans. The war is not ever, al though the C.A.B. won the first round on technicalities and was able, under threat of a Federal District Court in junction, to halt for 30 days the sale and use of the $199 roundtrip youth fareages 12 to 26from New York to Milan or Rome proposed by Alitalia, the Italian national airline.

title: Miller Leads Thistle Class
description: SAYVILLE, L.I., July 10Jim Miller of Oyster Bay, L.I., had a second and a first today to take the lead in the Thistle Class district championship. The series concludes with one race tomorrow at the Sayville Yacht Club.

title: Bake a pie to beat the heat
description: Frozen lime pie, tart and very cold, is an old summertime standby. The real secret of mak ing this particular recipe (given at right) is in how you handle the egg yolks. Heat them too much and they scramble. Too little and they won't thicken. If you have a candy thermometer, the maximumand idealtem perature for this process is 165 degrees. If you don't have a candy thermometer, then figure that when the yolks get too hot for your finger, they're hot enough. Any hotter and you'll produce a hot breakfast instead of a cooling dessert. This frozen lime pie, concocted by Pearl Foster, has been delighting customers at her Manhattan restaurant, Mr. and Mrs. Foster's Place, for years.

title: AMATEUR BOXERS SPAR WITH ELLIS
description: MIAMI, July 10, (AP) Jimmy Ellis, training for a July 26 bout with Muhammad Ali, sparred several rounds today with amateurs from the Pan American Games and National Amateur Athletic Union boxing teams.

title: News of the Camera world
description: FUJICHROME and Fuji color film, first intro duced into this coun try about one year ago by the Fuji Photo Film Com pany, is now nationally avail able in most parts of the United States and seems to be winning widespread ac ceptance. Available in all the popular roll film sizes 35mm (20 and 36 exposures), 120, and 126 cartridges (In stamatic type)Fuji's film comes in a negative type (daylight or blue flash only) for making color prints, or in a color reversal type (also daylight only) for making color slides. The company is also marketing their black andwhite film here.

title: FINAL ROUND IS 70
description: SOUTHPORT, England, July 10A horrendous 7 on the nexttolast hole today almost cost Lee Trevino the British Open that he had seemingly sewed up with a fivestroke lead halfway through the final day.

title: FOES OF SPRAYING WIN COAST ROUND
description: SAN DIEGO, July 10Oppo sition from half a dozen con servationist groups has forced the Federal Forest Service to call off plans to use a powerful defoliant, once employed in the Vietnam war, as a protective weapon against California forest fires.

title: Et Al.
description: Khler (18871967) was a founder of Gestalt psychology. This volume, intended to cele brate his 80th birthday, collects 21 of his articleson Gestalt theory, cognitive processes, animal psychology, brain physi ology, natural science, anthro pology and on various philo sophical questions. Ten of the pieces have not previously ap peared in English. Miss Henle, who teaches at the New School, has produced a labor of love and discipleship; but the collec tion is not so much for the gen eral reader as she believes.

title: Pitot of Apollo 14 Lost Weight and Weakened
description: HOUSTON, July 10 (UPI) Lieut. Col. Stuart A. Roosa, the Apollo 14 command pilot, lost weight and returned to earth weaker than his two fellow crewmen who walked on the moon.

title: Miss Gengler Takes Final
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., July 10 Marjorie Gengler of Locust Valley, L. I., the No. 1 Eastern women's player, captured the Northern Westchester tennis championship today by routing Lele Forood, 14, of Fort Lauder dale, Fla., 60, 62, in the final at the Pound Ridge Tennis Club.

title: Dalton's Darling Girl
description: IT took 32 years for some one to muster the cour age to make a movie of Dalton Trumbo's graph ically antiwar novel, Johnny Got His Gun. That someone turned out to be Trumbo him self. At 65, the veteran screen writer became a director and joined his soninlaw, Bruce Campbell, in bringing the powerful story of a World War I basket case to the screen. Now it appears that they have had beginners' luck, since the film has al ready won prizes at both the Cannes and Atlanta film fes tivals. And what may prove even more significant is the fact that the film is getting a firstclass distribution deal. Cinemation, Inc., the organiza tion that helped make Sweet Sweetback's Baadasssss Song a sweet success, has decided to devote itself almost ex clusively to Johnny Got His Gun for the rest of this year.

title: Rutgers Club Will Sponsor Junior Open Golf on Aug. 9
description: The Rutgers Golf Club will sponsor its fourth annual Rut gers junior open golf champion ship, Aug. 9 to 11.

title: Miller Wins Junior Title
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., July 10Steve Miller of New York, defeated. Jeff Potter of Scars dale, 75, 62, at the Bronxville Field Club today to win the Westchester junior tennis title today.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: The World
description: LONDONLike the little boy who cried Wolf once too often, anyone who talks about a last chance for peace in the Middle East nowadays runs the risk of being ignored as an alarmist. So many last dhances have come and gone there that it is tempting to think there are always more around the corner.

title: Keating Is Named to Head Eastern Football League
description: Bob Keating of North Easton, Mass., will head the newly formed Eastern Collegiate Club Football Conference, which will begin its first year of play in the fall.

title: The First Six Months
description: When a President has to work with a Congress con trolled by the opposition party, he cannot hope for smooth passage of his legislative recommendations into law. But he can usually block the initiatives of Congress with which he disagrees, can make his own proposals the center of discussion, and can sometimes find areas of agreement where important progress is possible. Presi dent Nixon has followed all three courses in his struggle with the 92d Congress during its first six months.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Last Word: The Balkan Model
description: The revelations in the Pentagon Papers are sure to give great impetus to revisionist historians. Those who are looking for explanations of American foreign policy in terms of military imperialism, the imperatives of the militaryindustrial complex, capitalist expansionism or ideological imperialism will find evi dence to serve them. Those who see American foreign policy in terms of revolution and counterrevolution, whether they see the origins at Yalta or even back in 1917, will also find what they are looking for.

title: CONVENTION HALE OPENED BY YORTY
description: LOS ANGELES, July 10  Mayor Samuel W. Yorty and Bob Hope, the comedian, of ficially opened today the $41.8 million Los Angeles Convention and Exhibition Center.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE NATION'S largest banks raised the prime rate to 6 per cent from 5 per cent. . . . President Nixon, ap pealing to patriotism and enlightened selfinterest, called on leaders of the steel industry and union to reach constructive contract settlement, after summoning them to the White House. . . . Paul W. McCracken, chairman the Council of Economic Advisers, implicitly conceded the gross national product would not reach the Administra tion's $1,065billion target and said the Federal budget was now $7billion more stimulative than was planned January.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: N.A.A.C.P. TO OPEN GERMAN BRANCH
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 10 The N.A.A.C.P. will soon char ter its first branch in West Germany.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: National League Seeks 9 in Row Over Rival in Classic at Detroit
description: Baseball's 42d AllStar Game will be played Tuesday night in Detroit's Tiger Stadium, with the National League aiming for its ninth straight victory over the American League.

title: The North Pole murder case
description: When he died in 1871, Charles Hall was closer to the North Pole than any Westerner had ever been. Ninety seven years later, Chauncey Loomis exhumed his body and discovered arsenic in it. This biography tells how Hall reached his lonely grave and suggests who may have killed him. It is both a firstrate detective story and a very scholarly work. Loomis knows the Arctic intimately and is sensitive to problems that confront strangers in this strange land.

title: SAN DIEGO WILL GET PARKLAND FROM U.S.
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 10 (UPI)The White House an nounced today that the Govern ment would turn over two par cels of Federal property worth more than, $2.6million to the Sari Diego authorities for use as parks.

title: Child to Mrs. Felber
description: JERICHO, L. I., July 10A daughter was born June 17 at the Nassau Hospital in Mineola to Dr. acid Mrs. Nor bert Felber. Mrs. Felber is the former Miss Edith Laulichk of Forest Hills, Queens. The child, whose father is a physi cian, has been named Susan Margaret.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: AmericanWestern Merger Proposal Termed Vital Test for Airline Industry
description: WASHINGTON, July 10  The proposed merger of Ameri can Airlines and Western Air lines, entering its sixth week of hearings before the Civil Aeronautics Board, is regarded as a case that could reshape an industrya preliminary but vital test of the airlines' drive to consolidate.

title: R. M. Butcher Weds Chryse Seidel
description: RYE, N. H., July 10Miss Christine Mary Seidel and Robert Miller Butcher were married here this afternoon in St. Andrew's by the Sea Episcopal Chapel. The Rev. Herbert Guth performed the ceremony.

title: Holden Among 4 Rookies Signing Saints' Contracts
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 10 (AP) Sam Holden, the New Orleans Saints' No. 2 draft pick, signed a contract, the team announced today. Three other rookies also signed.

title: MENTAL PATIENTS FREED BY RULING
description: HARRISBURG, Pa. July 10 Pennsylvania has announced plans to, prevent wholesale dis charge of patients from the state's 18 mental hospitals.

title: RIOTERS IN ULSTER FIRE ON ARMY POST
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, July 10 (Reuters) Raiders fired at least 22 shots from automatic weapons at military observation post in the Roman Catholic Bogside dis trict of Londonderry tonight.

title: All Eyes on Latest Venezuelan Horse
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 10Ever since Canonero II burst onto the turf scene in the Triple Crown events, horses arriving from Vene zuela have taken on a new importance.

title: The Juggernauts
description: Juggernaut is the author's image for today's mature corporations: an implacable monster to which the interests of human beings are sacrificed. Mr. Bannock, a British econo mist with business experience, posits three stages of corpo rate growth: infancy, youth, maturity (the last being the condition of I.B.M., G.M., Shell, etc.). Echoing Galbraith and Nader, Bannock shows how competition among the mature corporations is a myth, that scientific management is des tined to becoming dehumanize I and that the great corpora tions' domination of the market shrinks the latitude of consum er decision. Bannock advo cates decentralization  spe cifically, strict enforcement of antitrust laws. All in all, a lucid book but unoriginal.

title: The World
description: LONDON  Every historic choice involves challenge as well as opportunity. Her Majesty's Government are convinced that the right decision for us Is to accept the challenge, seize the opportunity and join the Euro pean communities.

title: Goldman, Sachs
description: At 55 Broad Street, a short way from the New York Stock Exchange, the fourth floor rips with action. It's the turf of the traders of Goldman, Sachs & Co., a with it assemblage of young men with longish haircuts and bright colored shirts that handles the third largest brokerage business on the Big Board.

title: The honest and admirable and dead Hugh Gaitskell
description: A political life is writ large until its epitaphWhere are the statesmen of yesteryear? Not in the diplomacy of this year. Nothing is more final than the death of a politician, while his burial before he can exercise power makes his whole life seem trivial. Plans are interred with bones, as the curt endings of both Stend hal's The Red and the Black and Malrawc's The Royal Way show, brusquely chopping short the read er's involvement with the intrigues of Julien and Perken at the death of each hero. No program fails like a corpse's, especially if he represents the people. Unlike El Cid, he can't campaign any more.

title: Rosewall Plays Dazzling Tennis to Defeat Taylor, 61, 98, in Wales Final
description: NEWPORT, Wales, July 10 (AP)Ken Rosewall de feated Roger Taylor of England, 61, 98, to retain the men's title in the Wales tennis champion ship today.

title: Explosion Kills 4 in Italy
description: LECCE, Italy, July 10 (Reu ters)Four persons were killed today and two others were injured when a canister of liquid gas exploded, destroying three beach huts near this city

title: Psychocybernetics And the Stock Market
description: A sort of Power of Positive Thinking applied to the stock market. Psychocybernetics involves a constructive input to weed out all the nasty little doubts you have about a stock. Lots of luck!

title: Pakistan Ends First Innings With 34Run Lead in Cricket
description: LEEDS, England, July 10 (Reuters)  Pakistani batsmen took the initiative away from England today on the third day of the third cricket test match. The first two tests were drawn.

title: Susan Necarsulmer Wed to John Dallin
description: CHAPPAQUA, N Y., July 10  Miss Susan Borden Necarsulmer, daughter of Henry. Necarsulmer, manag ing partner of the investment banking firm of Kuhn, Loeb & Co., and Mrs. Necarsulmer of New York, was married here this afternoon to John Gregory Dallin, son of Mrs. Dorothy H. Dallin of 13ellport, L. I.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: WEST MAY BUILD HOTEL IN MOSCOW
description: PARIS, July 10The Inter continental Hotel Corporation, a subsidiary of Pan American World Airways, has joined an ItalianAmerican consortium ne gotiating to build a $30million Western businessmen's center in Moscow.

title: LAIRD PROMISES JAPAN ARMS AID
description: TOKYO, Sunday, July 11 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird pledged today to help the Japanese SelfDefense Force im prove its equipment.

title: New Jetports Held Up By Protest Movements
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 10 More than three years ago, of ficials here announced plans to spend $105million to expand Portland International Airport, which hugs the southern shore of the Columbia River not far from the jagged snowy crest of Mount Hood.

title: Teaching Mothers How to Nurse a Child
description: The telephone rings at 6 A.M., and a woman answers to hear a frantic, but apolo getic, voice saying, I'm so sorry to call at this hour, but I just had to talk to somecne.

title: Redskins Acquire Burman
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) The Washington Redskins of the National Football League today acquired George Burman, a, 6foot3inch, 255pound cen ter, from the Los Angeles Rams for two undisclosed draft choices.

title: News of Dogs
description: The upstate Wallkill Kennel Club show is a community effort. At our show today, said Matthew Stander, the chairman, the town of Wal den provides us with Bradley Field. Two Boy Scout troops assist by selling programs and working at the gate. The Rotary Club provides## the food and the members of the police and fire departments con tribute their services.

title: SOLDIERS ATTACK MOROCCAN PALACE; KING KEEPS POWER
description: Moroccan Army troops at tacked the summer palace of King Hassan II outside Rabat yesterday, but loyalist troops thwarted the uprising quickly and the King remained in con trol.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: You were prudent in pointing out in a recent, editorial the dangerously shortsighted policy pursued by Wash ington with respect to the civil war in Pakistan which is reflected in its insistence in characterizing the Ben gali independence struggle as a strict ly Internal matter of that country.

title: Gowanus Canal Bridge Shut After 82 Years
description: The diminishing use of the Gowanus Canal and the city's depleted treasury are the central factors in the recent controversial closing of the Carroll Street Bridge to pe destrian and auto traffic.

title: Milos Forman's America Is Like Kafka/swim Basically Comic
description: THE lobby of the Chelsea Hotel on West 23d Street astounds. A medley of art formsfigures in papiermache, polychromatic can vases, electronic sculpture in steel and plastic  covers the walls, fills alcoves, dangles from the ceil ings. The collection appears at first to be at odds with itself and with the hotel's traditional ddcor, the heavy woodwork and the mantel piece carved with demons out of Victorian's opulent nightmare, but it soon takes on the air of absurd, fly blown charm that characterizes the Chelsea.

title: $65Million Excess In Defense Profits Is Reported for '71
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) Private space and defense contractors overcharged the Federal Government by more than $65million in the fiscal year 1971, a Federal watchdog agency reported today.

title: Laurent Dauthuille Dead at 47; Leading French Middleweight
description: PARIS, July 10 (AP)Laurent Dauthuille, who was once less than a minute away from the world middleweight boxing championship, died early today in a hospital in suburban Reuil. His age was 47. The cause of death was not announced.

title: Lia Manoliu: Poet Among Peasant DiscusThrowers
description: LONDON, July 10Lia Manoliu stands a little under 6 feet, weighs 187 pounds, and is the women's Olympic discusthrowing champion. She is also a qualified en gineer, researching into the effects of light and noise on factory workers, and she speaks excellent French and passable English. She has on her bookshelves the works of Sartre, Ibsen, Pirandello and Wilde.

title: Stargell's 30th Home Run of Year Gives Pirates 54 Victory Over Braves
description: PITTSBURGH, July 10 (AP) Willie Stargell's ftworun home run in the eighth inning gave the Pittsburgh Pirates a 54 victory over the Atlanta Braves today.

title: What Price A Steel Strike?
description: A steel strike is an eco nomic time bomb. If such a walkout should occur at the end of this month, it would not have the same immediate impact on innocent bystand ers as the 10week General Motors Corporation strike of last year or the 14week walkout at the General Elec tric Company in 1969 and 1970.

title: After 10 Heart Attacks Mangrum Looks Healthy and Wealthy at 56
description: APPLE VALLEY, Calif., July 10 (AP)  No one on the golf scene in the late nineteen forties had dreamed up such titles as the Big 3. Big 4 or even Big 4. But there was a powerful trium virate that dominated that period. In alphabetical order they were Ben Hogan, Lloyd Mangrum and Sam Snead.

title: U.S. Aides Fear Violence By Vietnamese Refugees
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 High United States pacification officials are reported to fear largescale urban violence be fore the end of the year in the densely populated Mekong Delta southwest of Saigon.

title: Policia de Nassau Estudian el Espanol
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 10  A woman born in Argentina held up a small American flag in front of a class of 25 po licemen and asked with smile:

title: Growing Up Black and Female
description: LET'S lift her skirt and see what kind of a thing she has under neath, taunts Nor ma, a fiery young black wo man, more than halfway through Black Girl, current ly at the Theater De Lys. Flashing a switchblade knife, she menacingly approaches Netta, also black and a recent college graduate on her way to law school. Surely, Norma reasons, Netta cannot be a female. How has she man aged to reach the age of 21 without getting trapped in the mire of feminine lower middleclass existence? Why should this poised girl be so invulnerable and unvictim ized? Why should she be master of her fate? There oan only be one answer she is not a real woman.

title: Reader's Report
description: This lampoon of life in a Hollywood animation sweat shop passes the acid test of such travesties: it is funny, even if you are unacquainted with the source of its satire. The time is 1939, a highwater mark for Wade Sampson Pro ductions and a rotten year for the rest of the country. A fledgling cartoonist named Am brose is indentured to the Sampson factory, flunks out of the Ricky Rat unit and is de moted to doing transitional drawings of Jerky Jack, a com ic rabbit. Mr. Ryan wrings a lot of humor out of Sampson's twin personality traits (penu riousness and paranoia) and shifts back and forth between satire and burlesque, all of it refreshingly hilarious.

title: Phils' Brandon Injured
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 10 (AP) Darrell Brandon, a Philadel phia Phillies pitcher, was in jured in an automobile ac cident last night driving home from the PhilsMontreal game. Brandon suffered loss of several teeth, cuts around the lip and a severely bruised left wrist. He is expected to miss at least a week of action.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: If July comes, can second quarter reports be far behind?

title: New Addiction Clinics Will Open This Month
description: The Veterans Administra tion is scheduled to open 14 new drug addiction clinics this month.

title: The Blue Whale
description: An informative study of the largest creature that has ever lived on earth. The blue whale, because of its speed and hab itat, long enjoyed immunity from hunting. When improved technology brought it within the range of the whaler's har poon, the slaughter began. Mr. Small discusses hunting meth ods, the greed of whaling com panies and other depressing matters. He estimates that there are something under 200 of these magnificent mammals left and says that if they escape extinction it will be a miracle. Nonetheless, he offers sugges tions for their conservation.

title: Jill McKelvie Will Marry on Jan. 8
description: Mrs. Richard Helms of Chevy Chase, Md., and Dr. Allan McKelvie, a surgeon of Washington, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jill McKelvie, to Jonathan Booth Hill. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Hill of Boston. Plans have been made for a wedding Jan. 8 in Washington.

title: Army Captain and U.S. Take Pentathlon Titles
description: THUN, Switzerland, July 10 (AP)Army Capt. Charles Richards of Tacoma, Wash., captured the individual title ta lead the United States to the team championship to day in a fiveday interna tional military pentathlon competition.

title: About Pro Football
description: A harbor of refuge is a place where boats can go when the weather becomes impossible. Rhode Island's Point Judith, with its man made breakwaters, would be an example.

title: Chiefs Defeat Stars, 20
description: ATLANTA, July 10 (AP)  The Atlanta Chiefs broke a fourgame slump by defeating the St. Louis Stars, 20, tonight at Atlanta Stadium.

title: Fun City? Milwaukee Has Its Problems But the Festival Is Worth a Visit
description: MILWAUKEEThe charms of this city on the western shore of Lake Michigan, says Milwaukee Journal columnist Robert W. Wells, may not be as apparent as San Francisco's foggy cosmopolitanism or Chicago's hopeful cynicism. But Mil waukee, he claims, is a place that grows on you gradually, like a beer belly.

title: Agnew in Ethiopia, Starting African Leg of World Tour
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 10Vice President Agnew ar rived here today to begin the African phase of his world tour and renewed the routine of sumptuous lunches, dinners and formal but highly generalized discussions that has character ized most of his trip.

title: Selling 3.Story Machines
description: ROCKFORD, Ill.It might be difficult to visualize a salesman hawking a machine three stories high on what, in essence, is a doortodoor basis.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Physician Will Marry Leslie Jill Goldin
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.I., July 10  Miss Leslie Jill Goldin and Capt. Neil H. Baum, U.S.A., plan to be married in the fall when the prospective bridegroom, a doctor in the Medical Corps, expects to complete his mili tary service.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Broker Who Found That Gardening Was No Easy Retirement
description: ANNANDALE, N. J.  Bertram M. Goldsmith retired from Wall Street two years ago and now he finds he's busier than ever fie gets up at 8 A.M. and instead of facing impatient traffic and caverns of concrete, he surveys Water cress Farm, his 28acre showplace es tate and decides what job he'd like to tackle that day.

title: U.S. PanAmerican Nine Downs Staten Island, 82
description: Fred Minis' threerun homer in the seventh inning helped the United States PanAmerican games' team defeat Staten Is land of the Atlantic Collegiate baseball league, 82, yesterday.

title: Willmar Wins at Calder
description: MIAMI, July 10 (AP)Tartan Stable's Willmar won the $7,500 added Cape Canaveral Handi cap today before a crowd of 9,884 at Calder Race Course.

title: Architecture
description: WASHINGTON is Pi nally going to have a good 20thcentury building. I will go further: Washington is finally going to have a great 20th century building. The rigid rule of mediocrity through uneasy compromise with an uncertain past that has char acterized the best and worst of Washington construction in our day will be broken by the new East Building of the National Gallery of Art, scheduled for completion in 1975. Let's go even further: it can be a great building for all time.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  If there has been a single develop ment in the last two and onehalf difficult years that has been most disappointing for the men who have guided this Administration's eco nomic policy, it has been the persistence of inflation psy chology.

title: E. A. Katzenberg Marries Susan Heims
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 10 Miss Susan Elizabeth Heims and Edward A. Katzenberg were married here this eve ning by Rabbi Barton Shallat at the White Plains Hotel where a reception was also held.

title: Chess
description: AN all powerful 16man round robin took place in Tallin, Esthonia, re cently. Former world champion and manytime Soviet titleholder, Mikhail Tal, split first and second by the score of 113 with Paul Keres, also an international grandmaster, and an Esthonian and Soviet manytime titleholder. Third with 11 was David Bronstein, who won the right to a world title match with Botvinnik in 1950 and drew; fourth was Leonid Stein with 10, a former Soviet champion. The rest of the participants were talented profes sionals.

title: National Notes
description: His prospects for victory? Fairly remote, said Republican Representative Paul N. Mc Closkey Jr. last Friday as he of ficially announced his candidacy for President. Richard Nixon is apt to give him a tougher run for the nomination than did Mrs. Shirley Temple Black, whom Mr. McCloskey defeated in winning his House seat. Another dark horse Presidential candidate sur faced last week, Senator Fred R. Harris of Oklahomabut at least he will have more company in his bid for the Democratic nomi nation.

title: RACE TO HALIFAX WILL START TODAY
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 10The largest fleet of off shore racing craft ever to com pete in an ocean race east of Cape Cod will leave this port in five classes tomorrow morn ing, destination Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Movies
description: KITTY WINN? This is one girl named Kitty who doesn't strip in Vegas or run a saloon in Dodge City. All right, her name may be misleading, but she prefers it to Katherine, and besides, it's her talent that counts, and Kitty Winn is a winner. The 27yearold stagetrained actress recently won the Best Actress award at the Cannes Film Festival for her outstanding performance as the middleclass, Middle West  girl  turned  junkie whoreinManhattan in The Panic in Needle Park, and yes, that was her own arm you see a needle sliding into on the screen. (The needle was filled with sugar water.) And yes, although she is reluctant to talk about it, she is the stepgranddaughter of the late General George C. (Marshall Plan) Marshall.

title: Mrs. Germaine Benjamin Plans Marriage to James Cromwell
description: Mrs. Germaine de Baume Gossler Christie Benjamin, widow of Henry Rogers Ben jamin, the financier and phil anthropist, will be married in the near future to James H. R. Cromwell of Birmingham, Ala., former Minister to Canada sand former husband of Doris Duke, the tobacco heiress. The couple have not yet set the date for their wedding.

title: The Madcap Travels of MAD Magazine
description: IN years past, Russia has been sacked by the Tartars, invaded by the Poles, besieged by Napoleon, upheaved by the Revolution and assaulted by the Nazis. This year the Soviet Union will face still another invader. The gang from Mad, the magazine of satire, going over.

title: One Crow, Two Crow
description: From the coast of Maine home of blueberries, lobsters and taciturnity  comes this homey family saga by Virginia Chase, Mary Ellen's younger sister. One crow sorrow, Two crow joy . . . runs the old chant, and it's one crow almost all the way for poor Laura Leighton, whose parents drown when an excursion steamer founders in a gale. Frustrated in her ambition to attend nor mal school, Laura marries weak, withdrawn Joel Classon, who has never recovered from having been deserted by his mother. Out on the lonely bar rens, where the berries grow, a hard Depression life is made harder by Joel's deepening psychosis. Miss Chase has a firm grasp of Maine topography and the smalltown past.

title: Interior Department Drops Objections to an Observation Tower Overlooking Gettysburg National Park
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 The National Park Service an nounced today that it had given its blessing to the construction of a controversial 307foothigh commercial observation tower at a site overlooking the Get tysburg National Military Park, one of the country's most visited historic landmarks.

title: Music Mailbag
description: After reading Joan Pey ser's interview with Pierre Boulez, one must assume that his appointment as conduc tor of the Philharmonic hard ly augurs well for music and its public. In fact, he may very well be the single de structive force that will undo the efforts of past great con ductors whose genius have made the Philharmonic what it is today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As you have correctly observed recently, the economists of the fiscalist school and those, of the monetarist school are each trying to explain the so far dismal performance of the economy during the present re covery.

title: U.S. Plane A ttacked in North; B52's Pound Area Below DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 10 (AP)  United States bombers continued their raids below the demilitarized zone today, the United States com mand reported.

title: Savile Row in LondonOld Traditions, Modern Prices
description: LONDON (AP) The tra ditional tailors of London's Savile Row, unperturbed by Carnaby Street and threats from the readytowear in dustry, are updating their image to remain clothiers to the world's bestdressed men.

title: Violists? That's Weird, Man!
description: I WAS standing around the corner newsstand the other evening, waiting for the city edition of the New York Review of Sex, when a strange man moved In next to me and took off a false beard and moustache; dark glasses and a fur hat. He turned out to be my friend Elias the orchestra conduc tor. He looked terrible.

title: Tobi Cohn Plans Bridal
description: EAST WILLISTON, L. I. July 10Mr. and Mrs. Sidney D. Cohn of East Williston and Palm Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Tobi Cohn, to Joel Slutsky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Slutsky of Miami. Miss Cohn and her fianc are graduates of the University of Miami. The wedding is planned for au tumn. Mr. Cohn is senior partner of S. D. Cohn & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange. The future bridegroom's father is vice president of the Don Green Provisions Corporation, food brokers in Miami.

title: Wash ington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 The White House gave classi fied copies of the Pentagon. Papers to the Senate and House with the explanation that Congress might other wise make judgments based on Incomplete newspaper ac counts of the topsecret his tory of the Vietnam war. But the New Zea land Parliament, which has pro vided troops to serve in South Vietnam at the bidding of the United States, will have to Make do with the published versions.

title: Miss Annette Zacho Married To Peter O'Malley of Dodgers
description: Miss Annette Zacho, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. Alfred Zacho of Klatnpenborg, Den mark, was married in Copen hagen yesterday to Peter O'Malley, president of the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball club. The ceremony was per formed in St. Ansgar's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Ib Andersen and was fol lowed by a reception at Solyst, the Royal Danish Shooting Club in Klanmen borg.

title: Yankee OldTimer Fans Get a Run for the Money
description: An insidethepark home run by Elston Howard pro vided an unlikely climax for the Yankees' OldTimers Day celebration at Yankee Sta dium yesterday.

title: Ann Soviero Engaged
description: State Supreme Court Jus tice and Mrs. Joseph M. Soviero of Brooklyn have an nounced, the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Grace Soviero, to Joseph M. D'Elia, son of Anthony P. D'Elia of North Bellmore, L.I. and the late Mrs. D'Elia.

title: Colombo Still in Coma
description: Joseph A. Colombo Sra re mained in a coma and in criti cal condition in Roosevelt Hos pital yesterday, 12 days after being shot in the head.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON  Dacca, the capital of East Pakistan, was re ported to be blacked out last week. Its power station ap parently had been knocked out by the insurgents of the Bengali Liheration Army. Another ma jor town, Comilla, was reported to have been without power for a weekfor the same reason. Despite the severe repressions of the Pakistan Army, the Bengali insurgency lives, and the issuo is likely to remain in doubt for a long time to come.

title: Mehr Wins Bay State Golf
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., July 10 (AP)Tracy Mehr, an assistant football coach at Am herst, captured the Massachu setts amateur golf champion ship today with a 7and5 vic tory over Alan O'Neil of New port, R. I. Mehr, a former Holy Cross golf captain, closed out the match on the 31st hole with an 18foot birdie putt.

title: Louise Went Bananas
description: THE face is familiar. It is a pretty, smiling, girl nextdoor kind of face. And now, after untold anonymous appearances in television commercials pitch ing everything from orange juice to gasoline, the name is catching up.

title: MACKINAC'S FLEET KEEPS 1970 RULES
description: CHICAGO, July 10Despite an extensive survey taken by the Chicago Yacht Club follow ing last year's stormy Mackinac race, in which more than half of the fleet withdrew, next Saturday's start will find few changes.

title: BEAME ASSAILS LAG ON TRAFFIC TICKETS
description: Traffic tickets that could bring the city $130million in fines are outstanding and the city expects to collect on fewer than half of them, Controller Abraham A. Beame said yester day.

title: Saigon's Cabbies Skeptical on Elections
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 8Saigon's cab drivers will vote in the coming elections, though like most ordinary Vietnamese, few feel the elec tions will make any difference.

title: Did Shakespeare dire of Timon?
description: THE most striking thing about the summer production of Shake speare's Timon of Athens in Central Park is a trio of buzzards flapping steadily away in the winds that sweep across the metal towers Ming Cho Lee has designed for the troubled and troublesome play. The buzzards are no more than kites of cloth, cutouts moored to the highest rigging. Their presence is unassertive, at first almost unnoticed. Then, faintly, their symbolic value is hinted at as they hover over this, rich man's house, waiting for the kill.

title: Francesca Paola Cuzzi Becomes Bride
description: PELHAM, N. Y., July 10 The marriage of Miss Fran cesca Paola Cuzzi to Ara A. Cambere, a vice president of Hornblower & WeeksHem phill, Noyes, the investment bankers, took place in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Perpetual Help here today. Only members of the immediate families at tended the ceremony, per formed by Msgr. Vincent W. Jeffers, assisted by the Rev. Robert Charlebois.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Hulme Earns Pole for 3d CanAm Race
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., July 10 No one will ever know for cer tain because the party of the first part disappeared imme diately, but it is possible that a snake slithering along the edge of the track today cost Denis Hulme one or two tenths of a second on one of his fast laps.

title: Television
description: REGIONAL control and diversity? Or national con trol and considerably less diversity? That, ad mittedly oversimplified, is the question hovering over the future development of public television.

title: Radiation Therapy On L.I. to Get Help Of Computer's Data
description: MINEOLA, L. L, July 10 Nassau Hospital is offering all NassauSuffolk hospitals and private doctors' offices having radiotherapy installations a computerized service to help plan their radiation therapy.

title: COLLEGE LEAGUES AIM TO CUT COSTS
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., July 10 (AP)  The rising costs of financing collegiate athletics has been a major topic at the 31st annual meeting of the Col legiate Commissioners Associa tion today on the third day of sessions here.

title: Reader's Report
description: If you like chases, here's a marathon for you. It ranges from East Coast to West Coast, stretching from one end of this husky volume to the other. Only a master architect of suspense could maintain the reader's in terest in such extensive mile age, and Joseph Hayes (The Desperate Hours) does a manful job of it, shifting the scen ery often enough to prevent highway hypnosis from set ting in.

title: Medicine
description: On a hot night late last month a suburban housewife, Mrs. Sam uel Cochran Jr. of Bedford Vil lage, N.Y., served cold vichys soise from a can for dinner. Hours later, her husband was dead and Mrs. Cochran was gravely ill both victims of botulism. The tragedy set off a national and international hunt for other canned products of the same fac tory which might be similarly in fected. And as the week ended, questions were being raised about the adequacy of safety precautions throughout the vast industry engaged in canning, freezing, vacuum packing and otherwise preserving processed foods.

title: Miss Nancy Ellen Mack Bride In Litchfield of Eric Kent Hatch
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., July 10Miss Nancy Ellen Mack, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ed gar R. Mack, was married here this afternoon to Eric Kent Hatch, son of Eric Hatch, novelist, playwright and screen writer, and Mrs. Hatch. The Rev. John E. Scavo, un cle of the bride and a Con gregational minister, per formed the ceremony in a wooded grove at the White Memorial Foundation, a pri vate wildlife sanctuary.

title: Secret Agent Testifies at Captain's Trial
description: LAKENHEATH, England, July 10A United States Air Force undercover agent who infil trated the antiwar movement among American servicemen here testified today at the courtmartial of Capt. Thomas S. Culver.

title: U.S. DELEGATION GOES TO ISRAELI FESTIVAL
description: A 56member United States delegation, including 30 boys and 15 girls between the ages of 15 and 17, will fly from New York today to Israel to partici pate in the Second International Israeli Youth Festival.

title: Bridge
description: IF offered a wish by his fairy god mother, a bridge player might well ask for the power to make the win ning opening lead consistently. This supernatural ability would help him most when faced by a blind lead, the result of an auction offering little in the way of clues.

title: A Victory for Montauk Ecologists
description: MONTAUK, L. I., July 10 Indian Field Park, Suffolk County's 18th and newest recreation area, was ticketed just a year ago to become a waterfront resort of from 1,500 to 1,800 homes on 960 acres overlooking Block Island Sound.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Late in July, the Paris cou ture will show its collections and the impact of the new images will once again rever berate around the world, fall ing here and pollinating, drifting there and lapsing into nothingness.

title: RussianBorn Ballet Expert Keeps on His Toes on
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., July 10  One of the best names in American dance, Andre Eg levsky, is alive and well and working in Massapequa. Al though Mr. Eglevsky was born in Russia, as a child he lived in France and for, many years he has made his home in the United States, becoming a citizen in 1939.

title: NEW SCHOOL PLAN IN EAST NEW YORK;Charrette Would Set Up Wide Educational Complex
description: The people of East New York want change, dynamic and in novative. They want no hand medown plans. They want to determine and guide this change.

title: Brazil Jails 16 as Subversive
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 10 (AP)  A military court sen tenced 16 persons yesterday to prison terms ranging from two years to four years on charges of subversion. The defendants had pleaded innocent and said they had been forced to confess to crimes they did not commit after being tortured in jail.

title: McCauley, Top Colt Choice, Agrees to Contract Terms
description: BALTIMORE, July 10 (UPI) Don McCauley, who broke O. J. Simpson's National Col legiate rushing record and was drafted in the first round by the Baltimore Colts, signed his rookie contract today, a day before the Colts open training camp.

title: The World
description: PARIS  On the surface, the 120th session of the Paris Con ference on Vietnam last week seemed as barren as the ones that went before: a debate on different wave lengths, an ex change of accusations and ques tions left hanging. Yet the jammed and sweltering press room of the conference hall was infused with that almost palpable excitement which attends a his toric moment. For the first time in three years of talks, it seemed that a vital decision might be in the making.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Humor and the mystery novel: the elements do not mix too well. It is not that they can't. Rather, it is because humor is hard to write, and few authors have been able to carry it off. (One thinks with a shudder of the great O. Henry's attempts to parody Conan Doyle.) The genre, by and large, has not attracted superior stylists through the years, and it is hard to think of a mys tery novel that is successful in its humor.

title: A merican Ballet Theater Oilers A Lively and Mellow Coppelia
description: Of all the versions of Cop plia, Enrique Martinez's pro duction for American Ballet Theater is the liveliest and most mellow. It has always had broad, and successful, touches of humor. In the work's first performance of the season Fri day night at the State Theater, some of these touches appeared merely broad.

title: Foreign Notes
description: A year ago the jubilant com mander of the South Vietnamese Army's IV Corps took a heli copterfull of reporters to the scene of his troops' victory over Communist forces in the Cam bodian town of Preyveng. The commander, Maj. Gen. Ngo Dzu, posed for photographers beside a display of captured arms in the city, which was still smoldering from rocket, mortar and bomb explosions.

title: Tigers Beat McLain, 42
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) Home runs by Aurelio Rodri guez and Jim Northrup helped Mickey Lolich beat Denny Mc Lain for the second time this season as the Detroit Tigers posted a 4  2 victory tonight over the Washington Senators.

title: M'BRIDE'S WINDOWS DOWN FOR LAST TIME
description: The closing of McBride's Theater Ticket Offices, Inc., which has been in business for 98 years, was confirmed yes terday by Leonard Zarlin, owner and operator of the ticket agency.

title: Statement on Toothpastes Denied By Lever Brothers
description: Lever Brothers said yester day that its Pepsodent an Stripe brand toothpastes did not contain stannous fluoride, as stated by Ralph Nader when he told the Federal Trade Com mission last Thursday that the substance contributed to teeth stains.

title: PARKS ADD PROGRAMS FOR TENNIS PLAYERS
description: The Parks Administration has started two experimental pro grams that will allow tennis players to reserve courts at selected locations and to get permits good for use on singleplay basis.

title: New NASA Administrator Weighs PostSkylab Flights
description: CAPE KENNEDY July 10 (UPI)James C. Fletcher, Ad ministrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Admin istration, said Thursday that the space agency was looking at a wide variety of possible earth orbital missions to fill the long gap in American manned space flight after the Skylab project ends in late 1973.

title: The New Play
description: TIMON OF ATHENS, the New York Shakespeare Festi val's production of Shake speare's play in Central. Park, got unfavorable re views from the four critics who covered it. Clive Barnes: An institution like the New York Shakespeare Festival has a responsibil ity to stage the lesser known plays of Shake speare as well as the more celebrated major works. Unfortunately, when a play by Shakespeare is lesser known there is usually a very good reason for it. Timon of Athens is one of Shakespeare's mature trag edies and it has some most beautiful poetry in it.
