Rabbi Paul Silbersher per formed the ceremony. The bride, a graduate of Hunter College, is office manager for the BeloveJacoby Devel opment Corporation. Mr. Be love, who was graduated from Syracuse University, is a principal of the concern, which has offices in Harts dale and Syracuse. His previ ous marriage ended in di vorce, as did his bride's.

title: REVSON CAPTURES ATLANTA CANAM
description: GAINSVILLE, Ga., July 11 Team McLaren reversed the usual order of finish today, with Peter Revson winning the Road Atlanta CanAm and Denis Hulme, the New Zea lander who usually wins, fin ishing second.

title: GlotzbachHassler Triumph In Volunteer 500 Car Race
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., July 11 (AP) Charlie Glotzbach of George town, Ind., with relief help from Friday Hassler, powered a 1971 Chevrolet to victory to day in the Volunteer 500, a National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing Grand Nation al event. Their time was 2 hours 38 minutes 12 seconds for an average speed of 99.926 miles an hour.

title: Harlem Youths Start Cleanup As Summer Job Project Begins
description: Twenty black youths, all in their teens, began to sweep and collect litter yesterday as part of a summer employment and community service program sponsored by the Better Busi ness Bureau of Harlem.

title: City U. to Do Consulting Studies For the Lindsay Administration
description: Some of the city's manage mentconsultant work which provoked a major controversy when it proliferated under the Lindsay administration  will soon be turned over to the City University.

title: Van Nostrand Easy Victor In State 35er Clay Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., July 11King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, seeded second, crushed Ed Freeman of Mine ola, 61, 6.0, to gain the third round of the New York State 35yearsandover tennis cham pionship today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Nastase Downs Leschly
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 11 (UPI)Ilie Nastase of Rumania defeated Jan Leschly of Den mark, 67, 62, 61, 64, for the men's tall in the $33,000 Swedish open tennis champion ship today.

title: McLain, Now at 515, Goes On Disabled List
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI)Denny McLain, a 15 game loser this season, was placed on the 21day dis abled list by the Washington Senators today because of arm trouble.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 11The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Israeli Treatment of Poor Defended by Zionist Leader
description: Rabbi Joseph P. Sternstein, vice chairman of the Zionist Organization of America, said yesterday that allegations by American rabbis that Israel had been indifferent to the plight of her poor were unwarranted, unfounded and irresponsible.

title: W. G. Engle Weds Mrs. Blanchard
description: In St. Paul's Chapel on the Columbia University campus yesterday Mrs. Cynthia Hem brow Blanchard was married to Wayne Girard Engle by the Rev. Chadbourne A. Spring, associate minister of the Community Church of New York.

title: Allende Accuses U.S. Copper Interests
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 11 President Salvador Allende Gos sens denounced today what he called avarice for profits and poor planning by United States management of large copper mines as Chile's Congress met to vote on nationalization of the mines.

title: PERU'S GENERALS AT ECONOMIC TURN
description: LIMA, Peru, July 11The Peruvian military government has arrived at a perplexing economic crossroads after near ly three years of heady revolu tionary marching down the path between capitalism and Communism.

title: Samuel Bronfman, Founder of Distillers, Is Dead
description: MONTREAL, July 11Sam uel Bronfman, founder and president of Distillers Corpora tionSeagrams Ltd., of Montreal and New York, died last night at his home in Westmount, Montreal. He was 80 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I was amused at A. O. Rock's July 6 letter in The Times about hitching to gether a group of buses and running them as a train, with one motor up front.

title: Thistle Class Race Off
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., July 11A dead calm set in today just as the fleet of 22 competing in the Thistle Class district champion ship approached the first mark and the race was canceled.

title: MICHAEL THOMAS CONDUCTS AT FETE
description: LENOX, Mass.; July 11  Michael Tilson Thomas, who led the Boston Symphony in last night's Berkshire Festival program, is one of those rare musicians who handle them selves so easily on a podium that prenatal influence seems the only explanation for it. Most musicians have to work to become conductors; a few have conducting thrust upon them; Mr. Thomas was born to it. No doubt he works at the job as hard as anyone, but it certainly does not show.

title: GOOD NEWS LEADING HALIFAX YACHT RACE
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 11  Good News, a 60foot sloop owned by the Maine Maritime Academy, was the early leader in the fleet of 94 yachts that left port today for Halifax, Nova Scotia, 360 miles to the east.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, July 11After Hitler, there were manyand not only Ger mans by any meanswho said they had had no idea of the extent of the horror. They knew terrible things were happening, but six million Jews in the gas chambers.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meeting at the request of the Senegalese Government 3:30 P.M.

title: College Town Puzzle: 18YearOld Vote
description: Ratification of the constitu tional amendment granting the vote in all elections to 18year olds has fueled a complex and perhaps even more controver sial issue in college towns across the country: Where will the newly enfranchised students be allowed to register and vote?

title: Books of The Times
description: OURSELVES. A novel by Jonathan Strong. 228 pages. Boston: AtlanticLittle, Brown. $5.95.

title: STATE SEARCH FINDS RECALLED SOUP HERE
description: Inspectors from the State Department of Agriculture and Marketing have located 100 cases of Bon Vivant vichys soise from the batch found contaminated with the toxin that causes botulism. None was found in stores north of West chester County.

title: British Ambassador Describes 5 Hours as Captive of Rebels
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 11 (AP)The British Ambas sador to Morocco described today how he narrowly es caped death at a diplomatic party that turned into bloodbath when an unsuc cessful attempt was made to overthrow the Moroccan monarchy.

title: A Steady Course Is Likely In CreditMarket Activity
description: The credit markets, faced with a moderately heavy over all schedule of financing activ ity but with no major uncer tainties at the moment, will likely laze along this week without showing very pro nounced changes in prices and yields.

title: Reds Win, 72, 53, Sweep Met Series;
description: CINCINNATI, July 11Just what the Mets needed this afternoon, as they groped their way toward a muchneeded, AllStar vacation, was another loss in new and disastrous fash ion.

title: Camp Where Yougsters Learn to Fly Before They can Drive
description: BANGOR, MeA new sum mer camp has taken off here that has everything for fly ing enthusiasts from Alpha to Zulu. It's called Camp Solo, and it has 26 potential pilots aboard from as far west as Arizona and Colorado, as far south as Maryland and Penn sylvania.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Now that The Times and Washing ton Post cases are disposed of by the Court, a relaxed exhaustion of either euphoria or dismay permits some postmortem reflections on the issues which it raised.

title: Practical Joke Forces Airliner Down in Ireland
description: LONDON, July 11What a Trans World Airline spokes man called a horrible prac tical joke gave an agoniz ing two hours to the captain and crew of a Boeing 707 air liner bound from London to Washington with 135 passen gers today.

title: The Economic Issue
description: On the assumption that a year from now the Vietnam war is overor at least the American involvement is so reduced that most voters will ignore itthe 1972 national election is like ly to turn on the economic issue. But what is that issue? Conventionally it is defined as unemployment and in flation, and there can be no doubt that both of these are serious prob lems, directly and indirectly.

title: DIETZ ECLIPSES LUCERNE RECORD
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, July 11  Less than four weeks ago Jim Dietz was stroking the Northeastern University heavy weight varsity in the last race of his undergraduate career at the Intercollegiate Rowing Re gatta in Syracuse. Last Satur day, at the Henley Royal Re gotta, Dietz rowed himself into the final against the world champion, Alberto Demiddi of Argentina, and lost by two lengths.

title: PRESIDENT SIGNS $5.15BILLION BILL TO AID EDUCATION
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 11President Nixon signed into law today a $5.15billion educa tion appropriation bill that in creases spending for the com ing school year by $375million above the President's request.

title: Gun, Disguised as Pen, Wounds Boy, 10, in Leg
description: A 10yearold boy, Mitch ell McLean of 16214 Brink erhoff Avenue in the Jamai ca section of Queens, was wounded in the left leg late Saturday night, when a .22 caliber pengun with which he was playing in a lunch eonette accidently fired. The boy was taken to Queens general Hospital, where his condition was listed as fair. He told police he had found [the unusual weapon on the floor of the luncheonette at 11006 New York Boulevard, near his home. Thinking it was a writing pen, he said, he was playing with it when it fired. The police believe a patron of the luncheonette Hand dropped the gun.

title: PRICE UNIT AIMS AT CURBING PIMPS
description: Police Commisioner Patrick V. Murphy has ordered a spe cial unit to gather information on pimps operating in Man batten because he is convinced that, to a large extent, prosti tution in midManhattan is handled by these pimps for organized crime.

title: HOUSE PASSAGE SEEN FOR C.E.S. CITATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) A contempt citation sought against the Columbia Broadcast ing System by the House Com merce Committee has a good chance of winning House ap proval, two committee members who voted on opposite sides of the issue said today.

title: Olivares Stops Foe
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, July 11 (AP)Ruben Olivares of Mexico, the world bantam weight champion, knocked out, Efren Torres of Mexico in the fourth round of a scheduled 1.0 round nontitle bout last night.

title: U.S. SAYS PLANES HIT GUNS IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11 (AP) Two United States fighter  bombers attacked a cluster of antiaircraft sites in side North Vietnam today and knocked out seven guns that fired on an American plane minutes earlier, the United States command reported.

title: Ruth Toby Greifinger Is Married In Jersey to James E. Rothman
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., July 11Miss Ruth Toby Greifinger and. James Ed ward Rothman were married here this afternoon.

title: The Price of Democracy
description: LONDON From across the Atlantic, the first thing that hits one about the Pentagon disclosures is that nothing like them could have happened here. Our legal processes would have strangled them before birth. Let me hasten to say that I'm not suggesting that this is a point to us. All systems of your kind or ours .what we call parliamentary demecracieshave some method of extracting information out of the executive and keeping it in check. Our method is by making the executive directly responsible to Par liament. Yours is in the last resort the press.

title: McGuire Soccer Chief
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 11 James P. McGuire of New York was elected president of the United States Soccer Football Association today at the organ ization's convention.

title: Roundup:
description: When Deron Johnson reached the major leagues with the Yankees in 1960, he was often referred to as an other Mickey Mantle. Weighing 210 pounds and standing 6 feet 2 inches, the powerful Californian seemed to have the same longball potential that Mantle exem plified.

title: Chamber of Commerce Urges Consumer Aids
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI)  The United States Chamber of Commerce asked its five million members to day to place more emphasis on consumer health and safety in product advertising.

title: Libya Again Backs Rebels
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 11 Libya continued today to ex tend support to the rebels who yesterday tried to assassi nate King Hassan.

title: ROSTOW UPHOLDS JOHNSON POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  Walt W. Rostow said today that the alternative to the Vietnam policies of President Lyndon B. Johnson possibly would have been a nuclear war.

title: Vasquez and Delgado Meet In 12hound Bout Tonight
description: David Vasquez of New York will defend his North American bantamweight championship to night in a 12round bout that features a boxing card at Madi son Square Garden. Vasquez will meet unbeaten Ricardo Delgado of Mexico.

title: Laird Finds Both Seoul and Tokyo Fear U. S. Cuts
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 11 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, who today ended visit to Japan and began one to South Korea, Is encountering in each country deep reluctance to go along with his basic mes sage: that the United States is reducing its military presence in Asia and that other nations must share a greater part of the defense burden in Asia under his concept of realis tic deterrence.

title: City Bank Is Taking a New, Breezy Approach in Britain
description: LONDON, July 11Even by hardselling American stand ards, the slogan might have seemed a little grating. But there it was, in Bristol, Swansea and Kilmarnock, Scot land, on a big whiteandblue button: What do you think you get at a Money Shop?

title: SOLOMON CAPTURES AMATEUR CLAY TITLE
description: CHATTANOOGA, July 11 (AP) Harold Solomon of St. Peters burg, Fla., defeated Charlie Owens of Tuscaloosa, Ala., 62, 26, 62, 64, to win the na tional amateur claycourt ten nis championship today.

title: Japanese Report Tremor
description: TOKYO, July 11 (Reuters) A weak earth tremor was felt in the northern part of Japan's main island of Honshu today, according to the country's meteorological agency. The epi center was located off lbaraki Prefecture in the Pacific.

title: KING HASSAN SAYS REBELS LEADERS WILL BE EXECUTED
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 11 King Hassan II of Morocco said tonight that four generals had clumsily mounted a Libyan style coup against him and had failed. He announced that the surviving rebel officers would be shot tomorrow.

title: BLUE FOX TAKES OVERNIGHT RACE
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., July. 11 Philip Walters's Blue Fox, from the Sagamore Yacht Club, today won overall honors in the Lloyd Harbor Yacht Club's 34mile overnight race to Strat ford Shoals and back.

title: Saccharin's Slim Safety Limit Based on a Mathematical Error
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) A mathematical error has led to the adoption of an un conventionally slim safety mar gin for the widely used artifi cial sweetener saccharin.

title: MOORE PREDICTION BEST IN CONTEST
description: BLOCK ISLAND, RI., July 11 The New York A.C. 58th an nual Block Island predicted log contest was won yesterday by James B. Moore's GinJine V for the third time in the last five years. He redeived the Sir Ken neth Lipton and the Jackson Memorial trophies.

title: Ramirez Wins Title
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., July 11 (AP)Raul Ramirez had to bat tle 3 hours 40 minutes today to beat Jim. Hagey in the final of the national junior hardeourt tennis dhampionship today, 36, 8.6, 1210, 2.6, 75. Both are from La Jolla. Laurie Tenney of Beverly Hills defeated Linda Lewis of Los Angeles for the girls title, 57, 6.1, 62.

title: Blast Rocks Mayor's House
description: CORNING, Ark., July 11 (AP) An explosion believed caused by a grenade shattered win dows and knocked three hub caps off a car at the home of Mayor E. W. Cochran last night, Dewitt Owens, the as sistant Chief of police, said to day. Mr. Owens said Mayor Cochran and his family were in St. Louis and that no one was at the home when the device exploded.

title: U.S. Blacks Play Role in Talks On South Africa's Development
description: JAN SMUTS, South Africa, July 11A group of Americans and South Africans, including some black men, today began a weeklong symposium on devel opment problems in this coun try.

title: INDIANS WILL SHIFT PAKISTANI REFUGEES
description: CALCUTTA, India, July 11 (Reuters)  India has decided to move about 2.5 million East Pakistani refugees to central camps to relieve the tremendous pressure on her border states.

title: Bus Plunges in India
description: LUCKNOW, India, July 11 (Reuters)At least 21 persons were feared drowned after a bus plunged into a lake in northern Uttar Pradesh Sate, officials said today.

title: Dance: Symbolic Actions of Annual
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 11The motivating energy of the Rudy Perez Dance Theater is dramatic tension, produced by the choreogra phic restrain he imposes on the surge of powerful emo tion. Perez himself has the performing elan of a con trolled volcano and the sur face of his work is stretched tautly and smoothly over the material it contains.

title: Europe Bonds Gain
description: BRUSSELS, July 11Prices in the international bond mar ket rose last week despite such potential troublemakers as in terest rate increases in the United States and recurring talk of the when and how much of a possible higher value for the West German mark.

title: West Virginia's Penitentiary Is Plagued by Shakedowns, Robberies and Violent Deaths
description: MOUNDSVILLE, W. Va.,  Fifteen men have died violently during the last three years in West Virginia's old and dilapid ated penitentiary here.

title: Pan American Air And T.W.A. Press Exploratory Talks
description: Officials of Pan American World Airways and Trans World Airlines expect to hold another meeting this week to review the possibility of a merger between their systems. Both Najeeb E. Halaby, chief executive officer of Pan Ameri can, and Charles C. Tillinghast, chief executive officer of T.W.A,. confirmed over the weekend that merger discus sions between their companies were held last Friday. Both men emphasize, however, that the discussions did not pro gress to the point of active ne gotiations but were similar to discussions each airline had held with other carriers pre viously.

title: Agnew Finds Foreign Doubts on U.S.
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 11Vice President Agnew asserted today that the leaders he had met on his tour have said, without exception, they felt that America's status as a world leader had been seri ously challenged by the publi cation of confidential Govern ment documents and by what the leaders described as a growing isolationist spirit in Congress.

title: BLASTS IN BELFAST MARK PARADE DAY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Monday, July 12 (AP)Several bombs exploded in Belfast early today, hours before huge pa rades were scheduled to com memorate a historic Protestant victory.

title: F.T.C. Is Investigating Toy Packaging Fraud
description: The Federal Trade Com mission office here said yes terday that it was investi gating consumer complaints of deception in the packag ing of toys.

title: U.S. to Extend jersey Corriiption Investigations
description: Federal lawenforcement of ficials in New Jersey will broaden their investigations of political corruption and or ganized crime in the next four or five weeks, Herbert J. Stern, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, said yesterday.

title: Yanks Sweep Series With Red Sox, 32
description: If Horace Clarke doesn't really like to read his name in the newspapers, then he's go ing to have to stop playing the hero. He batted the New York Yankees to a 32 victory yes terday over the Boston Red Sox before a crowd of 23,104 that sat through a drizzling rain.

title: Advertising:
description: Well, the weekend came and went with no news from Ford, and no news from the Postal Service. There was, however, a call from Jerry Della Femina. Thank good ness there are some folks you can count on.

title: C.B.S. Names Executive
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System has named Goddard Lieberson senior vice president, a new post. Reporting to him will be the new CBS/Records group, the CBS Columbia group and the Cinema Center Films, the movie division.

title: BRUHN ELEVATES A TOPPELIA HERE
description: Erik Bruhn is a great dancer and a great artist. This simple truth was reaffirmed in the per formance he gave with the vi vacious Carla Fracci in Ameri can Ballet Theater's Coppelia Saturday, afternoon at the State Theater.

title: Saigon's Forces Widen Duties as Vietnamization Progresses
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6The armed forces of South Vietnam have steadily widened their field of operations with the progress of Vietnamization.

title: Larchmont Race Week's Fleet Becalmed for 2d Day in Row
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 11 Larchmont Yacht Club's 73rd annual Race Week moved through its second scheduled competition today and still there has not been a com pleted race. No one around the club could recall that the first two days of the famed regatta were ever wiped out before.

title: Poland Said to Be Impatient Over Vatican Stand
description: WARSAW, July 11A Polish writer indicated today that Gov ernment authorities were grow ing impatient with the Vati can's delay in recognizing Poland's postwar acquisition of former German territories.

title: Sharon Mahoney Is Married Upstate
description: NORWICH, N. Y., July 11 Miss Sharon Marie Ma honey, a magna cum laude graduate of Marymount Col lege in Tarrytown, was mar ried here this afternoon to Robert David Hickson Jr., a graduate of the United States Military Academy, class of 64. The Rev. Thomas Kiernan performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass at St. Paul's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Zurich University to Reopen
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, July 11 (Reuters)Zurich University will reopen tomorrow after being closed for four days be cause of student demonstra tions, it was announced today.

title: St. John Yacht Wins
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., July 11  Ten skippers were able to get around in exceptionally light air today and complete sweeps of their classes as the Unqua Corinthian Yacht Club's invita tion regatta ended.

title: Miss Blalock Gets Closing 68 for 208 And 2Shot Victory
description: HORSHAM, Pa., July 11 (AP) Pigtailed Jane Blalock shot fiveunderpar 68 today to over come Kathy Whitworth's two stroke lead and win the $25,000 George Washington golf tour nament.

title: Miss Falck Sets World Record in 800Meter Run
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, July 11 (Reuters)Hildegard Falck of West Germany set world record for the women's 800 meters today with a time of 1 minute 58.3 seconds.

title: Egypt and Syria Said to Get More Planes From Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, July, 11The Soviet Union has sharply stepped up, in recent months, deliveries of jet warplanes and troopcarrying helicopters to Egypt and Syria, according to United States intelligence spe cialists.

title: Mountain Folk See the Land Go
description: ROBBINSVILLE, N.C., July 11Urban Americans hungry for land descended on this remote mountain town this weekend to buy large chunks of 15,000 acres of rugged private property surrounded by national forests.

title: Youth Attempts Holdup, Is Strangled in Scuffle
description: BUFFALO, July 11 (AP)A youth who attempted a holdup in a restaurant early today was strangled during the incident, the police reported.

title: ARMY EXPANDING DRUG ABUSE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 The United States Army has extended its program of drug abuse urinalyses that was be gun last month in Vietnam to the United States and Europe.

title: The Fifth Horseman Is Riding
description: JANESVILLE, Wis.  When I was a boy growing up in northern Wisconsin it seemed there would be no end to flowing rivers and clear lakes amid the forest.

title: TRANSIT UNION HERE PREPARES DEMANDS
description: The Transport Workers Union is formulating proposals for a new contract with the Transit Authority next Jan. 1, a union lawyer said yesterday when he was asked about the status of bargaining prepara tions.

title: Agent Blue in Vietnam
description: The United States has been destroy ing growing crops in South Vietnam since at least November 1961 as part of its resource denial program. This is accomplished largely by the aerial application of an aqueous solution of sodium dimethyl arsenate, Agent Blue; applied at the rate of 9.3 pounds of active ingredients per acre. This is a highly persistent (and potentially hazardous) chemical not domestically registered for use on or near crops.

title: SOVIET SABER TEAM RETAINS WORLD TITLE
description: VIENNA, July 11 (Reuters) The Soviet Union scored a 97 victory over Hungary to win the men's team saber title in the world fencing champion ships tonight. The victory was the seventh for the Soviet in eight years, and the fifth in a row.

title: Newcombe Takes Swiss Net Crown; Nastase Triumphs
description: GSTAAD, Switzerland, July 11 (Reuters)John Newcombe of Australia beat Tom Okker of the Netherlands, 62, 57, 16, 75, 63, in the final of the Swiss international tennis champion ship today.

title: Clifford Goldsmith, 72, Dies; Aldrich Family Originator
description: TUCSON, Ariz., July 11 (AP) Clifford Goldsmith, creator of one of radio's longest running programs, The Aldrich Fam ily, died at a hospital here today. He was 72 years old.

title: PENTAGON TOUR COST IS PUT AT $80,000
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) Government auditors say a Pentagon public relations tour for 63 civilians cost more than $80,000, five times the official estimate.

title: Fischer Wins Third Straight In Denver as Larsen Plays Badly
description: DENVER, July 11  Bobby Fischer tonight defeated Bent Larsen of Denmark for the third straight time in their chess match at Temple Buell College here.

title: Summer Steel Lag Seen
description: PITTSBURGH, July 11Steel officials are looking forward to a slow summer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I cannot write forcefully enough in support of William L. Shirer's position [OpEd June 26] that history is the loser when Government documents are long suppressed.

title: Books of The Times
description: ST. URBAIN'S HORSEMAN. By Mordecai Richter. 467 pages. Knopf. $7.95.

title: WELFARE ROLLS DROP AGAIN HERE
description: New York City's welfare rolls decreased in May, for the Second month in a row, the Department of Human Re sources reported yesterday.

title: SCHOOL BOARD DROPS PUERTO RICAN FILM
description: The Board of Education has withdrawn from its approved list of educational materials a film strip, and record combina tion after complainti that it Was demeaning to Puerto Ricans.

title: The Talk of Ocean Park, Wash.
description: OCEAN PARK, Wash.  At the low tide following the pre vious day's storm, the gulls swooped low over the stooped forms of clam diggers on the smooth, wet beach. Before daylight, the charter boats left the sheltered harbor be hind Cape Disappointment to troll in the salmon schools that abound at, the Columbia Riv er. On the bay side of the nar row peninsula, dredges moved through the oyster beds for stock to supply the shockers in the canning plants.

title: DR. WILLIAM A. WALKER
description: GENEVA, N. Y., July 11 Dr. William A. Walker, former ly attending orthopedic surgeon at Bellevue and Goldwater Memorial Hospitals and associ ate clinical professor of ortho pedic surgery at New York University Post Graduate Medi cal College, died today in Geneva General Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived here.

title: U.S. Openly Funds Two Radios Formerly Supported by C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, July 11The United States has quietly be gun open funding of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty, dropping any pretensions that the antiCommunist stations are privately owned and controlled.

title: BIG ALLIS IS BACK IN SERVICE AGAIN
description: Big Allis, the millionkilowatt electric generator, and the Con solidated Edison Company were both humming along happily yesterday.

title: Russians Are Tied
description: MOSCOW, July 11 (AP) Viktor Korchnoi and Tigran Petrosian played to their fourth draw today.

title: Barred in St. Louis, Priest Says First Mass Here
description: A 25yearold Roman Cath olic priest who had been denied ordination by John Cardinal Carberry of St. Louis yesterday celebrated his first Mass in his home parish, St. Kevin's Church in Flushing, Queens.

title: Western Central Bankers Discuss Money Problems
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July 11 (Reuters)Western central bankers met informally today at the Bank of International Settlements. They discussed ways of fighting the inflation problem and the disruptive ef fects of shortterm capital movements, central banking sources said.

title: Camel Driver Befriended by Johnson Says His Troubles Now Are Just Kismet
description: KORANGI, PakistanBas hir Ahmed, the camel driver who was swept up into a new world by Lyndon B. Johnson a decade ago, con templated the gift that changed his life completely, and for the worse.

title: Cable TV Conferees See Wide Gains but a Delay
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 The future of cable television has ducked behind a new set of clouds.

title: Hebrew U. Backers Elect
description: The election of Dr. Henry Sonneborn of New York as na tional president of the Ameri can Friends of Hebrew Univer sity was announced yesterday at the organization's head quarters at 11 East 69th Street. He succeeds Samuel Rothberg of Peoria, Ill., who will con tinue to be the international chairman of the university's board of governors. The Friends, with chapters through out the country, has played a large role in the Hebrew Uni versity's development for 40 years.

title: New Orleans Bids Farewell to a Son
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 11 The boys from Bourbon Street blew a big, brassy goodby to Louis Armstrong today.

title: Less Noise, Please
description: If Mayor Lindsay succeeds in seriously reducing the decibels now afflicting this city, he will have earned the gratitude of New Yorkers who do not even realize the daily damage being done to their nervous systems.

title: 35 Felled on Piers in Houston As Smog Again Envelops Area
description: HOUSTON, July 11An esti mated 35 longshoremen and dock workers became ill on the Houston piers late today as they unloaded ships in the Houston Ship Channel. There was a yellowish smog along the channel at the time, witnesses said.

title: Nixon's Talent Hunter Also Wields Executive Hatchet
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 Senior Government officials who have not been invited to the White House for a long time may be on Fred Malek's list for replacement.

title: Chess: Petrosian's Style Causes Korchnoi Support to Grow
description: The pecuniary rewards that come with the winning of the world chess championship are hardly negligible, but, compared with the rewards in almost any other sport or profession, they are small in deed. No man of genius would devote his whole life to chess if money were all he could get out of it. The fringe benefits that come with the crown include the respect and admiration of the world chess community or should.

title: Equal Play for Equal Work
description: What must be counted a significant, if unconceded, setback for women's liberation occurred recently in Haverhill, Massachusetts, when Sharon Poole was ousted from her post and denied the chance to pursue her calling. No one contended that she lacked proficiency or even that her personality jarred on her working colleagues. She was fired because she was female, though a few technical and quickly refuted pretexts were advanced to cover up an otherwise blatant defense of the male ego.

title: Levitt Calls on Legislature To Curb Rising State Debt
description: ALBANY, July 11  State Controller Arthur Levitt ex pressed concern today about the rapid growth in the state's debt and urged the Legislature to take steps to limit it.

title: FIRST N TEN WINS HORSE SHOW CROWN
description: The wheel of fortune finally stopped at the name of First N Ten yesterday as he won the regular working hunter cham pionship at the La Guardia Ki wanis horse show on the air port grounds.

title: Reserve Official Blames Banks In Part for Slums
description: WASHINGTON, July, 11 (UPI)The nation's banks helped cause ghetto problems of crime, decay and segrega tion by refusing to lend money for projects in the inner cities, Sherman J. Maisel, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, said today.

title: Toys of 70's: Guillotines and Hypodermic Needles
description: Thousands of American children are being hurt and maimed by unsafe and psy chologically damaging play things despite the enactment 18 months ago of a new toy safety law, a wide range of consumer activists contend.

title: Foreign Exchanges Find Bullish Mood
description: Most overseas stock exchanges, some of them taking their cues from New York, finished the first half of the year in a bullish mood. There were, a survey by The New York Times indicates, a few excep tions to this, and some mar kets were plagued by political and economic uncertainties that made predictions for the rest of the year difficult. Per haps the bleakest picture emerged from Italy, where the market was at its lowest since the doldrums experi enced in 1964.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Governor Rockefeller's plan for a referendum on a $2.5billion transpor tation bond issue has been approved by the Legislature and signed. Of this total $1.35 billion is to be ear marked for mass transit and $1.15 billion for highways.

title: The Republican Outlook
description: Having edged his way into the White House with no votes to spare, President Nixon haS systematically moved the Republican party's center of gravity, to the right. Two and onehalf years after he took office, he presides over a party more conservative than the one which nominated him in 1968 and considerably more so than the one which chose him in 1960. If public opinion polls and the results of last year's midterm elections are accurate indicators, President Nixon has not widened his party's base of support. His reelection is in doubt and the pros pects for his party's success are cloudier now than they were after the Miami Beach convention three years ago.

title: Judo Title to Appellbaum
description: Mel Appelbaum of the Wase da Club in Astoria, Queens, and Rickie Haimes of the Queens Judo Center won titles yester day in the East Coast judo championships at Queensboro Community College. Appel baum took the fourthdegree belt competition and Haimes the thirddegree.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With millions unemployed at all skill levels, how can we say we cannot af ford to man our schools, parks and hospitals adekluately? If everyone were working at jobs we prized more than these, then we could not afford them. But there are people eager to work now and not doing anything produc tive. To keep them alive through un employment compensation and welfare rather than paying them to provide services everyone wants is inhuman and inefficent and no less inflationary. This is 1930's economics we are practicingthe equivalent of killing pigs in the face of hungry people. Surely we know how to do better today.

title: Roundup:
description: Carl Yastrzemski of the Boston Red Sox yesterday de nied charges made against him by Billy Conigliaro, a teammate.

title: DYNAMITE IS LEFT FOR AUTHORITIES
description: One hundred and ninety seven sticks of dynamite were found at 11 A.M. yesterday, be hind some shrubbery at the northbound side of Palisades Interstate Parkway 1,000 feet south of the Alpine Lookout in New Jersey.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Why, a Yonkers Raceway official moaned recently, doesn't this sort of thing happen at the flats? Why is it always us that get stuck in the neck?

title: Germans Setting Own Office Hours
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, July 11  At Lufthansa's gleaming new office build ing here, and at many other offices and factories around West Germany, men and women now go to work when they want and stay as long as they wantwithin reason.

title: Tigrrr Takes Series
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 11 Wally Lineburgh of Cedar Point Y.C. in Westport, steering Tigrrr in nearcalm off River side X.C., posted a 2point vic tory today in the Connecticut area Lightning Class Governor's Club regatta.

title: Personal Finance
description: Like changing fashions in clothes, investment vogues come and go. Sophisticated individuals usually set the pace.

title: Bridge: Griffin and Neiger Teams Gain. Final in Fun City Play
description: Teams led by Tom Griffin of New York and Gene Neiger of New York reached the final of the Fun City regional knockout championship at the New York Hilton yestet day.

title: MRS. JOHN G. LOGAN
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., July 11Mrs. Edith Stokes Logan, widow of John G. Logan who was assistant society editor of the old New York Herald Tribune, died yesterday at her home here following a long illness. She was 81 years old.

title: KISSINGER IN PARIS TO MEET WITH BRUCE
description: PARIS, Monday, July 12  Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's national security ad viser, arrived here early today for discussions on the Vietnam peace talks amid speculation that he might visit Le Duc Tho, a member of the North Viet namese Nahum.

title: City Getting Trailer Park Despite Ban
description: State and city agencies are setting up a 56unit trailer park in the East New York section of Brooklyn, despite the Board of Estimate's controversial de cision last May to continue a city ban on mobile homes.

title: WagePrice Curbs Backed By Meany to Halt Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  George Meany, the president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., said today that the imposition of direct controls on wages and prices appeared to be the only answer to the problem of halting in flation in the American econ omy.

title: Queens Girl, 10, Assaulted By Intruder in Apartment
description: A man appearing to be in his late 20's escaped early yester day morning after criminally assaulting a 10yearold Queens girl in her mother's Arverne apartment.

title: Pedro's Car Loses Tire
description: NUREMBURG, West Ger many, July 11 (AP)Pedro Rodriguez, the Mexican Grand Prix driver who stayed in auto racing after his brother Ricardo was killed nine years ago, was fatally injured today In a crash during a European Interseries race.

title: Airborne Stewardess Sets Water Ski Mark
description: PINE MOUNTAIN, Ga., July 11 (UPI)Mrs. Barbara Clack, a 27yearold airline steward ess from Miami, set a wom en's world water skiing jump record today by leading 111 feet in the Master's water skiing tournament.

title: Sale Furniture That Doesn't Look It
description: This is the time of year when Bloomingdale's takes some of the pieces in its summer furniture sale and puts them in the store's elegant model rooms. Almost any furniture would look good at first glance in such a setting. But a steady gaze at these Items shows that a good many of them could hold their own anywhere. Take the big, soft, marsh mallowy look. It started in the thirties but since its re incarnation a few years ago (with changes and adapta tions, to be sure), it has stayed in vogue and the way that Bloomingdale's has done it for its own Sutton Collec tion can be quite appealing, sale or no sale.

title: Man in the News
description: PARIS, July 11Gen. Mo hammed Oufkir, an ascetic, gaunt soldier who fought as French Army officer during World War II, is known in France and Morocco for his efficient and rapid methods of quelling disorder. As Morocco's Interior Minister for the last seven years, he has maintained tight control over the police. It is to him that King Hassan II has now turned to re store order after the abortive military coup.

title: C. E. Simpson Jr. Marries Jill Cohan
description: CRESSKILL, N. J., July 11 Miss Jill Anne Cohan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Al vin Michael Cohan of Engle wood, was married here this noon to Charles Edward Simpson Jr., son of Mrs. Henry F. Johnson of Saddle River and the late Mr. Simp son.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The lesson which most of us derive from the latest bitter exchange be tween Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay is, I suppose, the one the Governor is trying to teach, viz that both the state and city had best get their budget spirals under control.

title: Brooklyn Cricketers Win
description: The Brooklyn Cricket League defeated the Metropolitan League by five wickets yester day at Walker Park. The Met ropolitan League scored 105, the Brooklyn League 106 for five.

title: Legal Aid Society's Work With Poor Held in Jeopardy
description: Five and a half years af ter becoming the official counsel for indigent defen dants in the city's criminal courts, the Legal Aid Society of New York is beginning now what its new president, Leon Silverman, calls a fight to survive in that role.

title: House Member Fears Loan Could Not Save Lockheed
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) A Congressional investigator said today that there was great risk Lockheed Aircraft Corpo ration would go bankrupt even if Congress authorized a Gov ernment guarantee of a $250 million loan to the company.

title: Tiny Isles in Pacific Make Big Waves
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 11 People in this part of the world are showing extraor dinary concern over a number of dots on the waters of the Western Pacific.

title: MRS. WILLIAM F. EWING
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., July 11 Mrs. Emily Fordyce Ewing, widow of William F. C. Ewing, former president of Alexander Smith & Sons, carpet manufac turers, died yesterday at the age of 66.

title: Discord in East Africa
description: The unwillingness of Tanzania's President Nyerere to recognize reality in neighboring Uganda threatens to wreck the East African Community, the most promising venture in regional cooperation in Africa. Mr. Nyerere waa outraged at the overthrow in January of his friend, President Milton Obote. He granted Mr. Obote asylum and refused to recognize Gen. Idi Amin's regime.

title: Mexican Sought Title
description: MEXICO CITY, July 11 (UPI) Pedro Rodriguez was a pa triot in a crash helmet whose dream was to bring the Formula One championship home to Mexico.

title: ZAMBIA TO PURCHASE CORN FROM RHODESIA
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, July 11 Zambia, faced with a heavy drain on her foreign exchange and the problem of keeping four million landlocked people from going hungry, is to mod ify her policy against trading with Rhodesia and buy corn from that country.

title: S.E.C Shaping Guidelines For a Simpler Prospectus
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 The prospectuses that investors try to read before deciding whether to buy a stock may soon contain simpler language, key captions in bright colors and charts that will dramatical ly illustrate such significant facts as the dilution of stock holders interest in a company. These changes would all be aimed at making prospectuses more comprehensible.

title: Arts Abroad
description: DUBLINThere was a re nowned traditional fiddler in County Kerry a few years ago called Padraig O'Keeffe, who used to refer to his fiddle as the Mrs. He never married, and he would tell of a mis fortune that befell a good fiddle he once had, and which he called the first wife.

title: PANKIN NOTCHES SWIM TRIUMPH
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., July 11 (UPI)Swimmers from the Soviet Union continued their domination of the breaststroke competition today by setting two meet records in the 100 meter events at the Santa Clara invitation meet.

title: MRS. VERNONAYER, 86, A RETIRED PRINCIPAL
description: Mrs. Gertrude Elise Johnson Ayer, retired principal of Public Schools 24 and 119 in Harlem, died Saturday at her home, 435 Convent Avenue. Her age was 86. She was the wife of Dr. Vernon A. Ayer, former direc tor Of the Central Harlem Dis trict Health Center.

title: WOMEN AT CAUCUS HECKLE M'CARTHY
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) Former Senator Eugene Mc Carthy was met with cries of sexist and a flurry of shouted questions today as he began an address to the National Wom en's Political Caucus.

title: OPEN GOLF TAKEN BY EICHELBERGER
description: MILWAUKEE, July 11 (AP) Dave Eichelberger finished with a threeunderpar 68 today for a onestroke victory in the $125,000 Greater Milwaukee open.

title: Headache Dept. at the Anderson Memorial Tourney
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., July 11Bill Hyndman 3d of Phila delphia, the senior member of the Walker Cup team, and Ed Tutwiler of Indianapolis cap tured the John G. Anderson Memorial golf tournament to day.

title: Karen J. Back Becomes Bride Of Dr. Bachman
description: Dr. Karen Jean Back, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel Albert Back of Arlington, Va., and Plum Point, Md., was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Donald Mark Bachman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Arnold Bach man of New York. Rabbi Ron ald B. Sobel performed the ceremony at the Plaza.

title: HOVING IS HOPEFUL ON SOVIET ART DEAL
description: MOSCOW, July 11Thomas P. F. Hoving, Director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, said today that he hoped an agreement would he reached with Soviet authori ties for the first important ex change of Russian and Ameri can art exhibitions.

title: BIG BOARD EASES TRANSFER RULES
description: The traditional boundaries of the investment community are being stretched beyond Wall Street under a new ruling by, the governing board of the Newl York Stock Exchange.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We agree with your editorial of July 2 that the Communist offer to release all prisoners of war if the United States agrees to withdraw its forces from Vietnam by the end of the year opens the way to a breakthrough.

title: Colombo Condition Same
description: Joseph A. Colombo Sr., who has been in a coma since he was shot two weeks ago before an ItalianAmerican Unity Day rally in Columbus Circle, re mained in critical condition in Roosevelt Hospital yesterday.

title: COAST EXCHANGE TO TRADE IN GOLD
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11 Almost everyone knows that Americans are prohibited from owning gold except as jewelry or in coin collections. It's right in the Gold Reserve Act of 1934.

title: Wilson Replaces Dierker On N.L. AllStar Squad
description: DETROIT, July 11 (UPI)Don Wilson of Houston was called today as a ilastminute replace ment for his teammate, Larry Dierker, on the National League AllStar squad.

title: Nader Group Plans Study Of Comsat's Operations
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said yesterday that he suspected the Comsat Cor poration, the nation's com munications satellite company, of being more interested in pro tecting profits for a telephone company than advancing space technology for the public.

title: Myopia Conquers Fairfield On Bostwick's 5th Goal, 109
description: BETHPAGE, L. I. July 11 George H. (Pete) Bostwick's fifth goal, a 60yard penalty shot, one minute from the fin ish gave Myopia a 109 victory over Fairfield today in the 12 goal final of the Northeast Cir cuit intracircuit tournament at Bethpage State Park.

title: PURCHASERS FIND PICKUPISGRADUAL
description: The creeping recovery con tinues.

title: Advertising:
description: Those of us who look to Tiffany & Co., for guidance in matters of taste must be terribly pleased that the venerable concern has taken a public stance on the matter of women getting tattooed. They're against it.

title: Russians Confirm A Drop in Pressure Killed 3 Astronauts
description: MOSCOW, Monday, July 12 The Soviet Union announced this morning that the three as tronauts aboard Soyuz 11 had died as the result of a rapid change in the air pressure in their capsule.

title: GROUP PURCHASES SATURDAY REVIEW
description: The Saturday Review and the tradebook division of the McCall Publishing Company have been purchased by a group led by two executives from the Boise Cascade Corporation. The purchase was made after Boise Cascade dropped out of the negotiations.

title: Crowds? Dirt? Noise? It's All Fun to Tourists
description: On the observation deck atop the Empire State Build ing yesterday, a visitor from England was holding a map upside down and trying to spot Kennedy International Airport by staring into New Jersey.

title: REUBEN LAZARUS, CITY AIDE, IS DEAD
description: Reuben A. Lazarus, a master of legislative drafting and long time, representative of New York City when laws govern ing municipal affairs were be ing prepared in Albany, died last night in Mount Sinai Hos pital after a long illness. He was 76 years old and had lived at 325 West 86th Street since 1933  with a farm home in Pawling.

title: ELKHOUND TAKES BEST AT WALDEN
description: WALDEN, N.Y., July 11A Norwegian elkhound scored an impressive victory at the Wall kill Kennel Club's show at Bradley Field today. He was Ch. Crafdal Tryg N Thors Rollo, owned by R. D. Helferty and Mrs. Glenna Crafts from Flint, Mich.

title: Capital Asks Aid on Mass Arrests
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The District of Columbia has asked the Justice Department's Law Enforcement Assistance Ad ministration for a $14,900 grant to help develop a contingency plan for the humane confine ment of persons arrested in mass protests.

title: PANAM NINE DOWNS ATLANTIC STARS HERE
description: Jerry Tabb of Tulsa Univer sity, the most valuable player in this year's College World SerieS, had two singles and a home run yesterday as the United States PanAmerican team posted a 42 victory over the Atlantic Collegiate Baseball League AllStars at Shea Sta dium.

title: MILLS TELLS OF ROLE IN ITALY'S SHOE CURB
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Rep resentative Wilbur D: Mills told a group of labor leaders today that he was partly responsible for the recent decision by Italy to limit shoe exports to the United States.

title: U.S. Aides Find No Shift In Mideast Arms Balance
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 United States officials declared today they were satisfied that the military balance in the Mid dle East remained unchanged despite evidence that Soviet arms deliveries to Egypt and Syria had increased during the last three months.

title: Kissinger Confers With American Delegation in Paris
description: PARIS, July 12Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's national security adviser, spent a day in Paris confer ring with the American dele gation to the Vietnam peace talks.

title: U.S. Troop Level in Vietnam At a FiveYear Low of 236,300
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 12 (UPI)  American military strength in South Vietnam dropped 3,100 men last week to a fiveyear low of 236,300 The withdrawal pace was near ly 50 per cent ahead of sched ule, according to United States command figures disclosed to day.

title: MacMillan Bloedel Cuts Salaries of Top 60 Officers by 5 to 10%
description: VANCOUVER, July 12 (Ca nadian Press)The top 00 ex ecutives of MacMillan Bloedel, Ltd., Canada's largest forestry products company, have taken pay cuts of up to 10 per cent for the balance of 1971, chair man J. V. Clyne said last night.

title: News Analysis
description: The battle between WPIX, owned by The Daily News, and Forum Communications, a group of diversified citizens challenging the station owner's continued use of Channel 11, is a vivid example of the role of a regulatory agency, the Federal Communications Com mission, in resolving an issue of formidable so cial and economic consequence. The controversy is noteworthy in F.C.C. annals be cause it is the first important case turning primarily on a matter the layman can com prehend: programing. Did The Daily News perform on Chan nel 11 in the public interest, convenience or necessity, or should the franchise be award ed to an untested rival on the basis of promises that it can do better?

title: HARNESS PADDOCK TO BE MONITORED
description: YONKERS, July 12Robert A. Glasser, chairman of the State Harness Racing Commis sion, directed Yonkers and Roosevelt Raceways today to install a camera for photo graphing people entering and leaving the paddock area.

title: Goals Set by Women's Political Caucus
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The Women's National Politi cal Caucus, a new organiza tion dedicated to increasing the political power of women, announced today the guide lines it will use in deciding what candidates it will support for public office.

title: HouseSenate Committee Recesses for Week Without Ending the Deadlock on Draft
description: WASHINGTON, July 12A House and Senate conference committee that has been try ing to reconcile differences in draftextension bills recessed for a week today, still dead locked over a Senate amend ment calling for total troop withdrawals from Vietnam.

title: F.T.C. TO STUDY TIES. OF OIL TO COAL MINES
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion is going to try to find out whether oil companies that also own coal mines or other energy sources are increasing prices through contrived shortages, a spokesman told Congress today.

title: NIXON SIGNS BILL FUR $225BILLION TO PROVIDE JOBS
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 12  President Nixon signed into law today the first general public employment legislation since the Works Project Admin istration of the nineteenthir ties.

title: Legislator Calls for Dismissal Of L.I. State Park Agency Head
description: WANTAGH, L. I., July 12 Assemblyman Joseph F. Lisa, Democrat of Queens, charged today that misuse of funds by the Long Island State Park Commission could mean that all Long Island state beaches would have to be closed by August.

title: Surprised Ali Floored hi Drill for Ellis Fight
description: HOUSTON, July 12 (UPI) A sparring partner knocked Muhammad Ali, former heavyweight champion, flat on his back today with short right to the chin during a workout for Ali's fight with Jimmy Ellis on July 26

title: News Analysis
description: Police narcotics raids in the city and around the country are growing larger and more frequent. Less certain, how ever, is what effect the raids are really having on America's drug problem.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Fall at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Gov ernment's weekly competi tive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Main Danish Issues Settled
description: BRUSSELS, July 12 (Reuters) Denmark and the Common Market settled today the major issues involved in Danish mem bership in the Community.

title: Man in the News
description: JACKSON LAKE, Wyo., July 12  Tom McCall was scarcely off the plane here last night when he was say ing critical things about a fellow Governor, Ronald Rea gan of California.

title: Jazz Figures Offer a Tribute To Armstrong at Town Hall
description: A program dedicated to the memory of Louis Arm strong on Saturday evening opened the series of six Connoisseur Concerts to be held at Town Hall on succeeding Saturday nights.

title: MOROCCO MUTINY STILL A MYSTERY
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 12 With King Hassan II in attend ance, the Moroccan Army to day buried 20 of its men who were killed on Saturday during the thwarting of an attempt to overthrow the monarchy.

title: PLANT IN HOUSTON TOED TO HALT GAS
description: HOUSTON, July 12 (UPI) The director of the Texas Air Control Board ordered the Stauffer Chemical Company to day to halt immediately the discharge of toxic gases that have made scores of dock workers ill over the last several months.

title: COPPER FUTURES REGISTER A DROP
description: In record trading, copper fu tures dropped yesterday on the Commodity Exchange after ris ing steadily since the start of the copper strike July 1.

title: Betty Furness Resigns Job And Criticizes Legislature
description: Betty Furness, whom Gover nor Rockefeller appointed as the state's first consumer af fairs adviser during his reelec tion campaign a year ago, re signed yesterday, charging that the State Legislature was more interested in protecting indus try than the consumer.

title: FIFTH AVE. COACH IN GRAY LINE PACT
description: Trustees of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and the Gray Line Corporation announced yesterday an agreement in principle for settling claims be tween the two companies and eliminating ownership of each other's stock. Neither company is in bankruptcy or other in solvency proceedings.

title: ManMade Lakes: A Haven or a Trap?
description: EDWARDSVILLE, Ill.  The canopied pontoon boat rocked gently as it eased into the wake of a speedboat pulling a water skier. Sitting in the bow, Wayne Reller pointed, one after another, to the trim, solidly built homes, some simple, some elaborate, that dotted the shoreline.

title: Humble Oil Accused
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) The Justice Department filed criminal charges today against the Humble Oil and Refining Company for alleged pollution of the Houston Ship Channel and Galveston Bay.

title: Kenny, Indicted Jersey Leader, Announces Political Retirement
description: JERSEY CITY, July 12  John V. Kenny, the 79yearold Hudson County Democratic boss, announced his total re tirement from politics today.

title: 2 Black Women Combine Lives and Talent in Play.
description: Two young black women whose backgrounds differ but who share the belief that black experiences overlap have combined their talents and experiences in their first Off Broadway production, Black Girl.

title: Notes on People
description: Lieut. Gen. Stanley R. Lar sen, the Sixth Army com mander who order the court martial of the Presidio 27 on mutiny charges, has been given a new assignment deputy commander in chief of U. S. Army Pacific. He also received the Army's highest noncombat award, the Distinguished Service Medal, and a 21gun salute at the Presidio yesterday.

title: Agnew's Tour: Lobs, Putts, Parties and Diplomacy
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 12 Within two hours of his arrival at the Nairobi Hilton here to day, Vice President Agnew, clad in light tan cardigan and gray plaid slacks, was hooking his first drive about 155 yards down the fairway of the Mu thaiga Golf Course.

title: State Spokesman Comments
description: TRENTON, July 121A state police spokesman Said today that troopers who stop and check motorists simply because they have long hair were acting out of their own personal feel ings and that they were not following official policy. Lieut. Gordon Hector said troopers may stop any motorist for a credentials check hut in the absence of any evidence of a crime that's where it's sup posed to end. The American Civil Liberties Union filed a Federal Court suit charging the state police with a systematic policy of illegal search of longhaired motorists on the turnpike.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Blue Will Oppose Ellis in AllStar Game Tonight
description: DETROIT, July 12 Base ball's 42d AllStar game is scheduled for tomorrow night in Tigar Stadium, one of the oldest but nicest ball parks, and the American League will try again to reverse a trend that has made the Na tional almost ridiculously successful in this annual competition.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: New Voices Heard in South Africa In Behalf of the 15 Million Blacks
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, July 9The blacks are getting cheeky, a farmer from the northern Transvaal complained during a visit to South Africa's administrative capital the other day. He is a local leader of the Reconstituted National party, an ultraconservative splinter group than accuses Prime Minis ter John Vorster of being soft on blacks.

title: Mine Head Pleads Not Guilty
description: JACKSON, Ky., July 12 (UPI) Charles Finley, operator of the Hyden, Ky., mine where 38 men were killed in an explosion last Dec. 30, pleaded not guilty today in Federal court here to 24 violations of the Coal Mine Health and Safety Act. Judge Bernard T. Moynahan set Mr. Finley's bond at $10,000 and continued the case until July 20 in Federal Court at Lexington, Ky. Mr. Finley was indicted on June 23 by a Federal grand jury in Pikeville, Ky.

title: Executive Changes
description: Frank W. Green, who became president and chief operating officer of Fieldcrest Mills, Inc., on May 26, has resigned this post, effective immedi ately, for personal reasons. G. William Moore, chairman and chief executive of the company, which manufactures home furnishings textile products, will also take over the presidency, a post he previously, held. Mr. Green, who is 45 years old, has been with Fieldcrest for more than 19 years. Neither he or Mr. Moore were available for comment on Mr. Green's resignation.

title: Dr. Frank Rosenblatt Dies at 43; Taught Neurobiology at Cornell
description: EASTON, Md., July 12Dr. Frank Rosenblatt, associate pro fessor of neurobiology at Cor nell University, died here yes terday in a boating accident. It was his 43d birthday. He lived in Brooktondale, N. Y., an Ithaca suburb.

title: Advertising:
description: One thing that strikes a visitor to the home of Frank Perdue in Salisbury, Md., is that almost everything that can be made in the form of a chicken is. There are chicken ashtrays, chicken pitchers and chicken lamps.

title: OFFICIALS SCORE TRAILER HOUSING
description: Members of the Board of Estimate and the City Counci were critical yesterday of the plan of state and city agencies to set up a 56unit trailer park in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn despite a city ban on mobile homes.

title: Aide Will Be Bride Of Senator Holline
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., July 12 (UPI)Senator Ernest F. Hollings, Democrat of South Carolina, and Miss Rita Louise Liddy, his research assistant in Washington, are engaged to be married, it was announced today.

title: Those Were Men in Yuba City
description: What has been unearthed along the Feather River in the peach country of California is not the least bit unusual in the United States. To those of us who have some familiarity with the situation of the farm worker it is not even shocking. It is par for the course. We shrug our shoulders; we know that if some reporter had not let the story out, it would have been carefully hid den from the view of the American nation. Several murders would have been reported in the local press. The sheriff's office, aided by the California Highway Patrol, would have kept it nicely quiet. It's in the best interests of the American consumer that he never really know at what price those canned elberta and freestone peaches can be marketed so cheaply.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 12Dr. Richard Raskind of New York won two matches to readh the quarterfinals of the New York State claycourt tennis championship for men 35 years and over today at the Port Washington Tennis Aca demy. He beat Herb Charlop of New York and Maurice Hy man of Freeport, L. I., by 6.1, 60 scores.

title: Sports of The Times
description: DETROIT, July 12Two weeks shy of his 22d birthday, Vida Blue hit Detroit today harder than anybody since Ralph Nader. But he was shy in no other respect: a blossom ing, lefthander with 17 victories, thr.ee defeats, 17 complete games, 188 strikeouts in 184 innings and a halfseason record of having allowed less than one and a half runs every nine innings for the Oakland Athletics. All that, and a fast wit to match his fast stuff.

title: More G.I.'s in Vietnam Joining Drug Users Amnesty Program
description: WASHINGTON, July 12  Lieut. Gen. Robert C. Taber, Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for manpower, says that the Pentagon's new drug testing program in Vietnam is prompting more service men to participate in a drug users amnesty program.

title: Albert and Labor Leaders Denounce Nixon's Economic Policy
description: WASHINGTON, July 12  Speaker of the House Carl Al bert joined George Meany and other labor leaders today in a wholesale denunciation of the Nixon Administration's eco nomic policies.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL AT LOW FOR YEAR
description: Steel production dropped last week  to the lowest level of 1971, partly because of the July 5 observance of Independ ence Day and partly because of generally weak market de mand. Major mills are not nor rnally closed for oneday holi days, but many smaller opera tions can be halted or run at a slow pace.

title: Costa, Argentina, Is Leader In Junior Dinghy Sailing
description: BABYLON, L.I., July 12  Martin Costa of Buenos Aires, the 18yearold junior and sen ior champion of the Argentine, had a first and a second today to take the lead in the Penguin Class Dinghy Association junior championship.

title: Ulster Protestants March; British Soldier Is Slain
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Tuesday, July 13  A British soldier was killed by a sniper in a Roman Catholic neighbor hood of Belfast yesterday. The incident occurred as the Prot estants of Northern Ireland marched in the annual parade of the fraternal Orange Order.

title: Dance: Bruhn Extraordinary in Sylphide Role
description: Another one of those mem orable performances with which Erik Bruhn is gener ously endowing American Ballet Theater's season at the State Theater took place Sun day night when he made his first appearance with Natalia Makarova in his own staging of Bournonville's La Syl phide.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President was at his San Clemente, Calif., home, where he signed a $2.2billion emergency em ployment bill.

title: Mayor Inspects Big Allis and Backs Con Ed SaveaWatt Campaign
description: Mayor Lindsay looked over the Consolidated Edison Com pany's Big Allis generator yesterday. The giant machine, shut down from last Wednes day to Saturday with bearing trouble, was merrily roaring away producing 900,000 kilo watts to meet the city's elec tric demands. The Mayor's visit came as Con Edison en gineers were trying to pin point the cause of a failure at the company's Sherman Creek substation in Manhat tan that plunged large por tions of upper Manhattan and the Bronx into darkness early yesterday. [Article on Page 35.] I didn't breathe very hard, I was afraid it might stop, the Mayor quipped later at the Big Allis site in Ravens wood, Queens. Both he and Milton Musicus, chairman of the Mayor's interdepartmental committee on public utilities, endorsed Con Edison's cur rent SaveaWatt conserva tion campaign. Louis H. Rod dis Jr., Con Edison's presi dent, said the city's con sumers were saving some 300,000 kilowatts below past normal use. Mr. Lindsay en dorsed atomic energy as the most efficient energy source for the future and backed Con Edison's second nuclear plant at Indian Point, N. Y.

title: G.M. Recalls 6,300 Vehicles For Inspection and Repairs
description: DETROIT, July 12 (AP)The General Motors Corporation re called about 6,300 new trucks, tractors and station wagons to day for inspection and possible modification.

title: U.S. LAG ON VOTING CHARGED BY MINERS
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP)  Dissident coal miners ac cused the Labor Department today of dragging its feet and refusing to overturn a key Un ited Mine. Workers union elec tion they say was stolen from them.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hospitals Board Urged by Member To Meet Publicly
description: The municipal hospital sys tem was urged yesterday to open its traditionally closed door directors meetings to the news media.

title: A Measure of Vindication for Gabriela Mistral
description: When Gabriela Mistral, the Nobel Prizewinning Chilean poet, died in 1957 at the home of her friend Doris Dana, in Roslyn Harbor, L. I., she left behind hundreds of pages of unpublished manu scripts and thousands of pages that were never trans lated into English.

title: TENANT ADVISERS THREATEN TO QUIT
description: Onethird of the members of a Tenant Advisory Council formed by City Rent Commis sioner Benjamin Altman have, threatened to resign in protest against what they call the uselessness of the organiza tion, it was learned yesterday.

title: RAHIGO CAPTURES MONMOUTH EVENT
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., July 12 (AP)Racing from off the pace to take the lead within a six teenth of a mile from the wire, R. S. Reynolds Jr.'s. Rhigo won the $8,500 allowance feature today at Monmouth Park.

title: Telephone Strike Is Planned In Much of Nation Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) Half the nation's telephone workers are set to walk off the job at 6 A.M. Wednesday.

title: Bold Ruler, Leading Sire for 7 Years, Destroyed at 17
description: PARIS, Ky., July 12 (AP) Bold Ruler, one of the great est sires in the history of thoroughbred racing, was de stroyed today after a recur rence of cancer in the horse's digestive tract.

title: Weaver Says Players Should Pick Reserves
description: DETROIT, July 12 (UPI) Earl Weaver, manager of the American League team for tomorrow night's AllStar Game, proposed today that players once again join in the selection of team members.

title: Steps to Block Pilfering Irritate Soviet Shoppers
description: MOSCOW, July 12At the Kalinin Prospekt supermar ket today there was some commotion near the exit. The store's grandmotherly looking controller, while examining the shopping bag of a woman, said: You have a jar of jam you didn't pay for.

title: Duquesne Offering Made
description: A group managed by the First Boston Corporation made a pub lic offering yesterday of 1.5 mil lion shares of Duquesne Light Company common stock at $23.375 a share.

title: The Sidewalks of New York
description: If prostitution is the world's oldest profession, it has become New York City's newest laW enforcement problem.

title: New Hampshire Shifts Vote
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 12 (AP)Gov. Walter Peterson signed a bill today shifting New Hampshire's 1972 Presi dential primary date from March 14 to March 7.

title: Byrd Deplores Deficit
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr. independent of Virginia, said today that the Administration was pursuing a disastrous eco nomic policy that would lead to a combined budget deficit this fiscal year and next of more than $55billion.

title: Babylon Republican Leader Given Up to 3 Years in Jail
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., July 12 Fred Fellman, former Republi can leader of the Town of Babylon, was sentenced here today to up to three years in the State Correctional Institu tion at Ossining after pleading guilty to stealing town Republi can funds in 1968.

title: Jurists Appeal to King
description: GENEVA, July 12The In ternational Commission of Ju rists urged King Hassan today to forgo the immediate execu tion of persons involved in the attempt on his life.

title: 3 STATIONS TO CURB ADS ON CHILDREN'S TV
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI) The PostNewsweek televi sion stations in Washington, Miami and Jacksonville, Fla., announced today major changes in their children's programing for next fall, including new re strictions on the use of com mercials.

title: HENRY A. LOWENBERG, A LAWYER SINCE 1927
description: Henry A. Lowenberg, a law yer here since 1927, died Sun day in Doctors Hospital after a short illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 8710 51st Avenue, Elmhurst, Queens.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Pete and Jim Bostwick Take Team Title in Ike Golf
description: EAST WILLISTON, L. I., July 12Those versatile Bost wick brothersPete and Jim added the 19th annual Ike Golf tournament team title to their many sports achievements to day as each shot a par 72 over the Wheatley Hills Golf Club course. Their 144 team score, combined with their qualifying score of 149 two weeks ago, gave them a winning total of 293.

title: Merger News
description: The WarnerLambert Com pany announced yesterday the filing of a suit in the Federal District Court in Washington, D. C., against the Federal Trade Commission and its members.

title: Ruggerio Leads by Shot With 69 in L. I. Title Golf
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, LI., July 12Sal Ruggerio of the Baiting Hollow Country Club fashioned a threeunderpar 31 on the final nine holes, despite a double bogey 5 at the 17th, to take a onestroke lead with a 69 as the Long Island Pro fessional Golfers Association championship began today at the Cold Spring Country Club. Par for the 6,654yard course is 37, 3471.

title: Humanities Agency Sets Up Annual Jefferson Lecture
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The National Endowment for the Humanities announced today the creation of the Jefferson Lecture in the Humanities. This will be an annual address by a thinker of international repu tation who will receive $10, 000 for his work.

title: City and State Are Expecting $200Million for jobs
description: The state and New York City expect to receive $200million and to create more than 15,000 new jobs for the unemployed over the next two years under the Emergency Employment Act signed yesterday by Presi dent Nixon.

title: JACK HURDLE, 62, PRODUCER FOR TV
description: Jack Hurdle, a radio and tele vision director and producer who presented Jackie Gleason's first network TV programs, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital, after a short illness. He was 62 years old and lived at 215 East 68th Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HENRY THOMAS
description: Henry Thomas, a construction electrician long active in Local 3 of the International Brother hood of Electrical Workers, died Sunday in Harlem Hospital after a short illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 654 St. Nicholas Avenue.

title: COSMOS WILL FACE APRON TONIGHT
description: After a month's absence, the New York Cosmos return to Yankee Stadium tonight to meet Apollon of Greece at 8 o'clock in a North American Soccer League match.

title: BIG BOARD FIRMS SHOW PROFIT DROP
description: Net income of a representa tive group of 76 large member firms of the New York Stock Exchange dropped to $33.3 million in May, less than half the $71.3million earned by the same firms in April, the ex change disclosed yesterday.

title: 13 DEMOCRATS URGE NIXON SEEK TAX CUT
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI) Thirteen Democratic Senators urged President Nixon today to reconsider his decision against seeking income tax cuts this year.

title: Flights Washed Out
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, July 13 (AP)  A tropical storm named Kim brushed the northern sec tor of South Vietnam today, washing out United States air operations with up to 10 inches of rain, and swept north into the Gulf of Tonkin.

title: Passenger Dies in Blast As Cuban Hijacking Fails
description: HAVANA, June 12 (Reu ters)A passenger was killed yesterday when a grenade exploded during an attempt to hijack a Cuban airliner, the Cuban radio reported to day.

title: MARION NITITTY, OBSERVER AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 12Mrs. Marion Hazard McVitty, a wellknown person ality here as an official observ er for the World Federalists, died yesterday of cancer at St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 60 years old.

title: Excerpts From World Bank Group's Report on East Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, July 12  Following are excerpts from a report by a mission of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Develop ment that visited East Palzi start last month and from a report on a survey of the western area of the province by Hendrik van der Heijden, an economist and member of the mission. The reports were obtained today by The New York Times.

title: NOVEL ON CAR MODEL IS PLANNED AS FILM
description: The Betsy, a novel by Harold Robbins about the four year planning, development and manufacture of a new model of an automobile, which is slated for publication by Simon & Schuster In the fait will be filmed by Warner. Bros and Cinema Video Communications next year.

title: Shop Talk
description: Twentythree years ago, just after World War II, a fashion magazine used a Ca pezio ballet slipper to acces sorize one of the fullskirted shirtwaist dresses of the peri od. Since we were one of the first retail accounts Ca pezio had, recalls Murray Gerstein, we got the editorial credit. We weren't expect ing what fol lowed. We is the French Boot Shop at 541

title: Javits Asks Nixon to Use Wage and Price Controls
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Sen ator Jacob K. Javits urged Presi dent Nixon today to impose wage and price controls.

title: WILLIAM G. MARBURY, RAILROAD CHAIRMAN
description: FESTUS, Mo., July 12 (UPI) William G. Marbury, chair man of the board of the Mis souri Pacific Railroad Company and president of the Mississippi River Corporation, died yester day at his home here. He was 59 years old.

title: Women's Job Rights Gain In Federal Court Rulings
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 Federal courts across the nation have unloosed a stream of de cisions in recent months that appear to be on their way to ward wiping out all state laws that prohibit women from work ing in certain types of jobs, and that limit their hours of work and decrease their opportuni ties for promotions.

title: Air Canada Ground Workers Stage Walkout in 2 Cities
description: MONTREAL, July 12 (Reu ters)Ground staff members of Air Canada walked off their jobs tonight in Montreal and Toronto in a contract dispute.

title: American League 11 10 Pick
description: LAS VEGAS, July 12 (UPI) Jimmy (the Greek) Snyder, the oddsmaker, tabbed the Ameri can League an 1110 favorite today to beat the National. League in tomorrow night's AllStar Game at Detroit. The American League has won only one of the last 14 games.

title: Miss Ziegenfuss Beaten
description: MUNICH, July 12 (AP)1 Helga HoesL of West Germany defeated Valerie Ziegenfuss of San Diego, 61, 63, for the women's title in the Bavarian tennis championships today.

title: Progress Seen on Bill For Aiding Lockheed
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (Reu ters)The Senate Banking Committee was believed to have made progress today toward drawing up a bill to provide Government loan guarantees to the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Plastics Prices Raised 4 to 6%
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rub ber Company said yesterday that it would increase prices of plastic film and sheeting used in a wide range of com mercial, agricultural and house hold items by 4 per cent to 6 per cent, effective Aug. 1.

title: U.S. and South Koreans Pledge Joint Deterrent to Aggression
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 12 The United States and South Korea joined today in an ex pression of continued deter mination to maintain strong forces here capable of deter ring aggression.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amex Prices, Opening Strong, Close Mixed as Trading Eases
description: After opening strong, prices eased and closed mixed in moderate trading on the Amer ican Stock Exchange yester day.

title: Lockheed Situation Puts Banker on the Spot
description: William Henry Moore, the 56yearold chairman of the Bankers Trust Company, is a banker on the spot. This Thurs day, he is scheduled to try to convince the House Banking and Currency Committee that the Government should guarantee $250million in additional loans to the Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration to allow it to build its L1011 Tristar airbus. Bankers Trust is a principal creditor of the company.
