When the engine developer is selected, the Army plans, to seek competitors for the airframe for the new heli copter squad carrier, which will be the replacement for the Bell UH1D. Those asked to bid on the engines are the General Motors Corporation's Allison division, Airesearch Manufac turing Company, General Elec tric Company, Avco Corpora tion's Lycoming division, Solar division of the International Harvester Company; Pratt & Whitney Aircraft division of the United Aircraft Company; CurtissWright Corporation, Teledyne Inc., and United Air craft of Canada, Ltd.

title: Storm That Failed to Stop Fools Experts on Weather
description: The deluge and violent thun derstormswith a tornado or twothat struck the metropol itan area would not have hap pened if the elements had fol lowed the traditional rules of weather maps.

title: Murphy Removes Two Top Officers In Narcotics Unit
description: The two top officials in the Police Department effort against narcotics, whose unit has been criticized by the State Com mission of Investigation as in efficient and corrupt, were removed from their commands yesterday.

title: Caracas Signs Oil Law;
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, July 30President Rafael Caldera placed all foreign petroleum companies under effective state control at noon today by sign ing the Hydrocarbons Rever sion Law, which was passed by Congress here 10 days ago.

title: ARNO SCHOLZ
description: BERLIN, July 30 (AP)Arno Scholz, owner and publisher of the West Berlin newspapers, Telegraf and Nacht Depeche, died today at the age of 68.

title: Nixon Calls for Rail Pact, Citing Threat to Economy
description: WASHINGTON, July 30President Nixon called rail union and management officials to the White House today and told them to end their contract dispute quickly because of the serious economic im pact of the current strike.

title: A Security Conscious U.S.I.A. Sets Angle for Venetian Blinds
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 The United States Informa tion Agency has ordered em ployes in its headquarters on Pennsylvania Avenue to tilt venetian blinds upward at a 45degree angle to foil would be spies with telescopiclens cameras.

title: Nuptials in Mexico For Marina Jessup
description: Miss Marina Jessup, daugh ter of Richard Jessup, novel ist and screen writer, and Mrs. Vera Jessup of Wilton, Conn., and Nokomis, Fla., was married yesterday in Mexico City to Jaime Pio NoriegaBernechea, professor of chemical engineering at the University of Mexico. The ceremony was performed at the Parroquia de San Sebastian Chimalistac by the Rev. Francisco Macedo, a Ro man Catholic priest.

title: 26 Hurt in San Francisco TakeOff Accident, Worst Mishap for a 747
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 30 (UPI)A Pan American 747 with 212 persons aboard hit a runway light on takeoff today, injuring 26 persons in the worst accident for the large jetliners since they went into service 18 months ago.

title: Shop Talk
description: It's always the right time of year to get in shape, the problem usually is get ting around to doing some thing about it. Some womenfind exercises a bore. Others can didly admit that they are too lazy for strenuous rou tines. One answermight be a new salon that disguises exercise under a layer of dance movements. The studio is called Dance 'N Shape, and Sandy Berwald, the woman behind it, was herself a dancer (Guys and Dolls, Finian's Rainbow, among others). The routinesshe has devised are done to music and are a combination of ballet and modern dance forms. Mrs. Berwald is all for personal attention and there fore confines her classes to a maximum of five.

title: Judge Here Frees Indians Of StatueDefacing Charge
description: Charges against five Indians who had been accused of splashing red paint on the bronze statue of Teddy Roose velt outside the Museum of Natural History last June 13 were dropped yesterday.

title: Court on Coast Rescinds Order on Chinese Pupils
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 30 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit rescinded today its order that excluded Chinese pupils from plans to integrate San Francis co's 95 elementary schools.

title: DR. JOHN H. NAIR, FOOD RESEARCHER
description: SYRACUSE, July 30  Dr. John Henry Nair, a leader in research in dehydrated foods, died here on Monday on a golf course. He was 78 years old and had lived in Raleigh, N. C., for the last eight years.

title: Judge Refuses to Delay Tax on Leaded Gasoline
description: State Supreme Court Jusitce Darwin M. Telesford refused yesterday to delay the collec tion of a new centagallon city tax on gasoline containing lead that is scheduled to go into effect at 12:01 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Even by Fun City standards, it qualified as a rather scandalous week.

title: Prices of Gasoline Soar as Subsidies In Area Are Ended
description: COMMACK, L. I., July 30 Wide areas in Long Island, as well as in Brooklyn, Queens and Westchester County, have been hit by heavy increases in gasoline prices since the major oil companies quietly with drew their price subsidies on Wednesday.

title: China Said to Decline Parley
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 Officials disclosed today that China had informed France that she would not attend a five power nuclear disarmament conference. The conference was proposed in March by the Soviet Communist party head, Leonid I. Brezhnev, following the 24th party congress. The proposal was reiterated today by Pravda.

title: 8 SEIZED IN RAIDS AT 42D ST. STORES
description: Seven bookstores handling pornographic material on West 42d Street were craided by the police yesterday afternoon and eight men were arrested.

title: The Talk of the Pathans
description: DARRA ADAM KHEL, Pak istan, July 6There is an at mosphere of hard work, hon esty and friendliness in this tribal town, where most peo ple devote their lives to mak ing submachine guns, assassi nation pistols and hundreds of other lethal weapons.

title: U.S. LOSES A PLEA TO ROVE PIPE SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The Government lost today its at tempt to have a major environ mental law suit shifted from. Washingtan to Alaska.

title: NIXON DROPS PLAN FOR COAST SPEECH
description: CANTON, Ohio, July 30  President Nixon canceled a trip to California tomorrow to ad dress 1,600 influential Califor nians because, the White House said, he respected complaints from the press that his remarks would be off the record.

title: NonElection in Queens
description: Now that the ballot is vouchsafed to the young, the poor and the black, something should be done to restore suffrage to the people of Queens. Theoretically they still have it, but Councilman Matthew J. Troy, that county's Democratic leader, iswith full Republican assistance making it more of a mockery than Carmine De Sapio in his palmiest days ever tried to make it in Manhattan.

title: Nimeiry Frees 100 Prisoners
description: KHARTOUM, July 30 (Agence FrancePresse)General Nimei ry today marked the eighth day of his return to power by xe leasing 100 of those detained as a result of last week's coup.

title: Yosemite Teaching Tourists To Sightsee Without a Car
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.In the spec tacular Yosemite Valley, be neath tumbling waterfalls and soaring granite cliffs that were carved and pol ished by glacial ice two million years ago, the Ameri can tourist is learning to live for a while without the auto mobile.

title: Talks Seek to Bar Steel Strike Tonight
description: WASHINGTON, July 30A high official of the United Steelworkers of America said today that steel companies had made a very stingy offer for a new contract but that prayerfully a settlement could still be reached before a strike deadline set for midnight tomorrow.

title: 8 NEGRO GROUPS FORM STAGE UNIT
description: Eight New York black thea ter groups have banded to gether for the purpose of institutionalizing black thea ter and in the hope of ob taining a more equitable share of funding by nonFederal and Federal agencies, it was an nounced yesterday.

title: Mrs. Jean S. Tase Married To Dr. Richard C. Putnam
description: RADNOR, Pa., July 30 Mrs. Jean Sheperd Tase of Bryn Mawr, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard C. Sheperd of Bronxville, N. Y., was married here this afternoon to Dr. Richard C. Putnam of Devon. The Rev. Wilbur Laudenslager performed the ceremony in St. Martin's Episcopal Church.

title: Borrowings at I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The International Monetary Fund sold $135million of gold and Special Drawing Rights to 14 member countries today to re plenish its holdings of those countries' currencies.

title: CITY IS DELUGED IN VIOLENT STORM
description: Persistent rain, thunder and lightning surged over a wide area in and around New York yesterday, snarling automobile and subway traffic and causing scattered disruptions in tele phone and electrical systems.

title: Schmidt, Schwartz Score In National 35er Doubles
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 30 Jim Schmidt of El Paso, Tex., and Sid Schwartz of Great Neck upset the thirdseeded team of King and Alan Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, 76, 62, to reach the doubles semi finals of the United States clay court tennis championships for men 35 years and over tonight.

title: Toys Are Talk of Sesame Street
description: Retail toy buyers in New York have just received their first look at Big Bird, Oscar the Grouch and Cookie Mon ster  characters they may never have heard of before but which are already wellknown to 8 million children through out the country.

title: Righetti Lost to Browns
description: HIRAM, Ohio, July 30 (AP) The Cleveland Browns said to day that Joe Righetti, a defen sive tackle, would undergo an operation Monday and would be lost to the team for the sea son. A spokesman said that, the 23yearold Righetti had a con genital uteropelvic obstruction.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMAZONIAN COSMOS. The Sexual and Re ligious Symbolism of the Tukano Indians. By Gerardo ReichelDolmatoff. Illustrated. 290 Pages. The University of Chicago Press. $12.50.

title: Reform Synagogues Name New Director
description: The New York Federation of Reform Synagogues an nounced yesterday the ap pointment of Rabbi Robert J. Marx as its director.

title: Enemy Is Reported Repulsed In Attack in Central Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 30 (AP)The North Vietnamese broke a long lull in the Central Highlands today with an attack on a ranger camp and were repulsed, a Saigon spokesman reported.

title: Democrats Retain Control Of the Connecticut Senate
description: WEST HAVEN, Conn., July 30 (UPI)Control of the Con necticut Senate has been left in Democratic hands following Representative John D. Prete's victory over Alex Botte, a Re publican, in a special election yesterday.

title: Market Place: 4 P.M. Closing At Philadelphia
description: Investors who have been accustomed to the closing of the New York Stock Ex change each afternoon at 3:30 may be interested to learn they can have many of their trades executed until 4 o'clock in another market.

title: Mets' Gentry Tops Cubs, 40;
description: Gil Hodges finally got some of his frontline troops back into action last night and Gary Gentrysurrounded by security pitched the New York Mets to a 40, fourhit victory over the Chicago Cubs.

title: GRAINS ARE MIXED ON CHICAGO BOARD
description: Wheat was fractionally high er, corn and soybeans mixed and oats fractionally lower at the close of trading yesterday at the Chicago Board of Trade. Wheat was up  to  cents a bushel, corn was off  to up , oats were down  to  and soybeans were off to up 1.

title: LTV LISTS LOSS FOR 2D QUARTER
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., holding company that derives nearly all its income from ma jority interests in its publicly owned subsidiaries, had an op erating profit in the second quarter and first half this year before extraordinary charges. Large deficits were shown, how ever, after extraordinary items, according to yesterday's mid year report from Dallas head quarters.

title: Navigational Tools Needed for First Time in Moon Exploration
description: HOUSTON, July 30  Large scale exploration of the earth only became possible after the invention of the compass and other navigational tools. Now, for the first time, exploration of the moon's Surface has sim ilarly become dependent on such devices.

title: GAMBLER LINKED TO FALSE ARRESTS
description: A grand jury investigating at least a dozen accommoda tion arrests by policemen in an effort to cover up a gam bling operation indicted a con victed gambler yesterday for refusing to answer questions about alleged bribes.

title: Historyscapes
description: Although Pickett's Charge was stopped at Gettysburg and the Confederate, Army retreated, Southern fried chicken purveyors and similar alien forces have renewed the attack on the flanks of the Civil War's most famous battlefield. The latest incursion on the serenity of the National Military Parkwhich many people forget is a cemetery as well as the site of President Lincoln's Address  is a planned commercial observation tower (one dollar for a look) that would hover over the coun tryside as the most prominent landmark at Gettysburg.

title: Federal Immunity To J. J Kenny Held To Bar Jersey Case
description: NEWARK, July 30A Fed eral judge prohibited the State of New Jersey today from prosecuting John J. Kenny, be cause he had been granted im munity to serve as one of the Federal Government's star wit nesses in the recent extortion conspiracy trial of Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City.

title: Welfare Group Plans a Political Role
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I, July 30 The National Welfare Rights Organization has drafted plans to involve its racially mixed membership of more than 125, 000 poor people in local and national politics.

title: U.S. YACHT LEADS IN 210MILE SAIL
description: COWES, Isle of Wight, July 30 (UPI)By late evening on the first day of the Admiral's Cup yachting series, the defend ing United States had taken firm grip on the 210mile chan nel race, the first of four.

title: Fordham Trains TeacherAdvocates
description: A program has begun at Fordham University to train an unusual kind of teacher, one who will learn about his craft from policemen, judges and probation officers, as well as from traditional sources.

title: Walter Toscanini, 73, Who Led Project on Father's Music, Dies
description: Walter Toscanini, who col lected and preserved the record ings made by his father, Arturo Toscanini, and who also amassed many other memorabilia of the fainus conductor, died yester day at his home, 2500 Johnson Avenue, Bronx. He was 73 years and had been in ill health after haying suffered a stroke in 1968. A scholar, collector of rare books and an authority on the dance, Mr. Toscanini An 1955 presented to the New York Pub lic Library a collection of bal let scores, prints; rare books, miscellaneous clippings and other items pertaining to the ballet that belonged to his late wife, Cia Fornaroli, a former ballerina of the Metropolitan Opera and of La Scala in Milan. Later that year, he also presented to the library his own collection of hundreds of prints relating to the ballet.

title: Off the Rails
description: It is the considered view of at least half the governors of the United States that the current railroad strikes are having a critical to disastrous impact on the economy. The language may sound alarmist, but it would be foolish to belittle the effect of these strike actions, which have already shut down ten of the country's railroads.

title: Change in Reserve Is Formally Denied
description: WASHINGTON, July 30  The White House finally denied today, without ambiguity, that President Nixon was consider ing any change in the size or status of the Federal Reserve Board.

title: HOUSE PANEL VOTES DESEGREGATION AID
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (AP) A longdelayed bill to pro vide Federal aid to help schools desegregate has been approved by the House General Subcom mittee on Education.

title: Oh Boy! What a View!
description: FALCON (8:21 P.M., E.D.T.) Overhead hatch is open and latched. I'll sit on the engine cover facing forward. I'm at the drogue and rotate coun terclockwise. I'll block the sun from the instrument panel.

title: Senate Votes LaborHealthWelfare Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The Senate passed today with no dissentinab votes a $21.1billion appropriations bill for labor, health, education and welfare programs that is more than billion dollars over last year's figure.

title: Shafer Lauds British Program
description: LONDON, July 30  The chairman of the United States Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse, Raymond P. Sha fer, today praised the British program of supplying regis tered heroin addicts with lim ited quantities of the narcotic at Government centers.

title: Captain Heath at the Helm for Admiral's Cup Races
description: SOUTHSEA, England, July 30Edward Heath went to sea today in a beautiful ma hogany yacht, the first Prime Minister to play a part in a big ocean race.

title: SCIENTOLOGY WINS APPEAL ON METER
description: WASHINGTON, July 30  A Federal judge condemned today the use of an electrical gadget purported to be a cure all, but he permitted the Church of Scientology to continue to use the instrument in its re ligious practices.

title: TV: Sonny & Cher, Their Image Much Tailored
description: It's a summer variety se ries called The Sonny & Cher Comedy Hour, and the first installment can be seen tomorrow evening from 8:30 to 9:30 over the network of the Columbia. Broadcasting System.

title: OTB COMPUTERS WORKING AGAIN
description: The offtrack bettor had good news yesterday. OTB Corpora tion computers were back in operation for the first time in eight racing days and a full variety of betting will be avail able when action shifts to Saratoga Monday. In addition, the target for the start of sameday payoffs was moved up.

title: ANOTHER WAR CRIME IN VIETNAM CHARGED
description: WASHINGTON, July 30An other reported crime against Vietnamese nationals by mem bers of the Americal Division has come to light here in rec ords of the United States Court of Military Appeals.

title: Drysdale 62, 62 Victor
description: QUEBEC, July 23 (Canadian Press)The giantkiller finally came to the end of his streak at the $5,000 Quebec interna tional tennis open today.

title: Trustee Files Plan Of Reorganization For Jersey Central
description: Robert D. Timpany, the Fed eral trustee of the bankrupt Central Railroad of New Jer sey, filed a reorganization plan yesterday for that 592mile car rier with the Federal District Court in Newark. Within the next 10 days Mr. Timpany is expected to file his plan with the Interstate Commerce Com mission in Washington.

title: BARNETT KOOPERMAN
description: WALDEN, N. Y., July 30 Dr. Barnett Kooperman, who retired as a general surgeon in 1950, died today in Cornwall Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived on Rock Cut Road.

title: Air Force Is Blamed
description: TOKYO, July 30 (AP)Ex perts said today the air disaster could be attributed partly to the failure of the Japanese Air Force to heed warnings issued by the Administrative Management Agency that Air Force planes were intruding into commercial airline routes. Experts said there were more than 200 incidents of near misses involving Air Force planes and commercial air liners in 1970. misses involving Air Force planes and commercial air liners in 1970.

title: Notes on People
description: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, the Arkansas Demo crat and powerful chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, had terse and tongueincheek answers to questions at the National Press Club.

title: R. Frank Harrel, ExAide Of Young & Rubicam, 66
description: DARIEN, Conn., July 30 R. Frank Harrel, who retired in 1967 as a vice president and manager of the copy department of Young & Rubicam, Inc., died yesterday of a heart ailment at his home, 149 Brookside Road. His age was 66.

title: Shares of Jensen Bought by Kenton; Price Undisclosed
description: Merger News

title: Fund Redemptions Held Stable
description: Neither the stock market nor the owner of mutual shares has anything to fear from cur rent levels of net redemptions in the industry, a group of fund specialists told the New York Society of Security Ana lysts yesterday.

title: Aid Limited to Lockheed Voted by House, 192189
description: WASHINGTON, July 30  The House of Representatives approved tonight, by the un expectedly small margin of three votes, a compromise ver sion of legislation aimed at preventing the bankruptcy of the Lockheed Aircraft Corpora tion.

title: Kapp Cited in Grievance Instituted by N.F.L. Group
description: AMHERST, Mass., July 30 (AP)The New England Patri ots said today they had been advised by the National Foot ball League player relations committee that it has filed a grievance with the N.F.L. Play ers' Association against Joe Kapp. Kapp left the Patriots' camp two weeks ago over a contract matter.

title: Dora Triumphs on Time In Race to Marblehead
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 30The New York Yacht Club cruise made its annual run from the Cape Cod Canal to Marble head today, and many of the boats probably wish they hadn't.

title: Activities on the Moon Will Be Shown on TV
description: Television viewers will be able to watch the Apollo 15 astronauts on their explora tions of the moon, if all goes well.

title: Freud Aggression Theory Unpkoved, Daughter Suggests at Vienna Parley
description: VIENNA, July 30  Anna Freud suggested at a congress of psychoanalysts here today that her father's theory of ag gression was stilt unproved.

title: Londoners Who Prefer New York Tell the Reasons Why
description: Fed up with their own city, not a few New Yorkers think that life must surely be bet ter in London.

title: No Word on Afghan Flood
description: GENEVA, July 30 (AP)The League of Red Cross Societies disaster bureau said today it had no new word from Afghan istan on reports of a landslide that destroyed a natural reser voir in the Hindu Kush Moun tains, resulting in flood waters that swept away a village and killed 1,000 people.

title: Bridge: Declarer Gets Rich Reward As Opponent Underleads Ace
description: A sectional Swiss team championship begins today at the New York Hilton un der the auspices of the Greater New York Bridge Association. Sessions begin at 1:30 P.M. and 7:30 P.M. today and 1 P.M. and 7 P.M. tomorrow. Teams mar :born pete for one day only.

title: Big Four Confer on Berlin Without Substantial Gains
description: BERLIN, July 30The Big Four met again today on Berlin without making substantial progress.

title: Black Panther Here Is Charged In the Shooting of 2 Policemen
description: Richard Moore, who jumped bail last winter in the Black Panther conspiracy trial here, was charged with attempted murder yesterday in the ma chinegun shooting of two po licemen last May 19.

title: Sunset Park Youths Say Force By Police Brought on Violence
description: Youths residing in the Sunset Park section of Brooklyn told the police yesterday that ex cessive use of force to break up crowds had kindled a series of rockthrowing rampages in the area this week.

title: Fanny May Sets Auction Of 12Month Commitments
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 The Federal National Mortgage Association, following up plans announced earlier, said today it will conduct an auction Aug. 16 for 12month standby mort gage purchase commitments.
